loans.name: Cristian Gonzalo

texts.en:
Cristian dreams of becoming a professional, but without a degree he knows it may never be possible. Cristian was accepted into the Universidad Mayor de san Andrés, and now with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. He plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Cristian plans on spending the loan towards purchasing his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Cristian hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Cristian currently works 25 hours a week and earns $4 a day to help him afford his school and living expenses.With a degree in business, he expects to earn $10 a day. As the youngest of four, with two older siblings attending college already, Cristian is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

Cristian's father works as a driver, and his salary is the family's primary source of income. Cristian hopes to be able to contribute towards his family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for books and supplies.

loans.name: Adela Maria

texts.es:
Desde el año 2005, Adela de 46 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos. Ella tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 18 y 20 años, con quienes sueña ver exitosos.  Adela en su barrio, ubicado muy cerca al mar, todos la conocen y la refieren, por su buenas costumbres y su gran solidaridad. Su negocio inició, cuando una amiga de ella le sugirió dedicarse al comercio y la referenció, convirtiendo su decisión en exitosa, cuando empezó a vender productos mediante catálogos. 
Perfumes, cremas cosméticos y accesorios femeninos, son los artículos de su oferta; ella vende directamente a los clientes, mediante la modalidad de crédito por una parte, mientras la otra, lo hace de contado. Antes de Ingresar al programa de la Fundación, Adela, sirvió de codeudora a su vecina, para apoyarla y poco a poco  la ha visto crecer. Hoy ella quiere lograr mayor crecimiento y ser apoyada también con crédito;  por esa razón acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de belleza, cremas, perfumería y accesorios que adornan usualmente a la mujer. Con su credikiva planea incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades, aprovechando la temporada que se acerca, como lo es último bimestre del año, donde ocurre usualmente un repunte en las ventas. Su meta mas adelante es abrir un local al público, y terminar de remodelar su vivienda  y muy seguramente con el gran empeño que tiene junto a su esposo, se harán realidad todos sus proyectos y especialmente aportarle a la educación de sus 2 hijos, que se encuentran estudiando
texts.en:
Adela is 46 years old. She has been working in sales, selling from catalog and brochures, since 2005. She has 2 children who are 18 and 20 years old and she has dreams that they will be successful. Adela lives in a neighborhood near the sea, and everyone who knows her mentions her good manners and affability. 

Her business began when a friend of hers suggested that she engage in business and catalog orders, and her decision became successful when she began to sell products through catalogs. She offers perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and accessories for women. She sells directly to her customers, partly through credit and partly by cash.

Before entering the program of FMSD, Adela was a co-signer in her neighborhood, in order to gain a footing, and little by little she has been seen to grow.

Today she wants to achieve higher growth and also to be supported through a loan which is why she came for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can buy beauty products such as creams, perfume, and accessories that beautify women.

With her Kiva loan she plans to increase her sales and profits, taking advantage of the upcoming season, the last two months of the year, when sales generally go up. Her goal for later is to open a public facility and finish remodeling her home and most probably through the great efforts of both her and her husband all her designs will become reality especially supporting her 2 children who are students.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, creams, perfumes, and accessories

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
Jorge, está decidido a invertir nuevamente en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, necesita comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, para preparar debidamente la tierra y sembrar a tiempo para sacarle el mayor provecho a la temporada. 
Con el crédito anterior obtuvo mejor producción, más clientes satisfecho. Con los nuevos ingresos cambio notablemente sus condiciones familiares, todos están saludables.
texts.en:
Jorge has decided to invest once again in the harvest of corn and bean crops. He needs to buy fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide to properly prepare the land and plant on time to get the most out of the season. 

With the previous loan he was able to achieve greater production and have more satisfied customers. With the new earnings his family's living conditions changed notably. His whole family is in good health.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, todos dependen económicamente de él. Debido a la necesidad de generar más ingresos hace tres años instalo una tienda en su casa, en la cual ofrecen artículos de primera necesidad, el negocio es atendido por él y su esposa.
Con el capital el comprara jabón, aceite, variedad de golosinas, azúcar, y otros; su finalidad es tener más surtida la tienda para generar ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su economía y salir de la deuda adquirida, también de esta forma satisfacer a sus clientes y atraerá a otros nuevos.
Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una mejor vida y que sus hijos tengan un oportunidad de educación superior para que sean futuros profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and lives with his wife and five children who are all economically dependent on him. Due to the need to generate greater earnings, he installed a small store in his home three years ago where, he offers basic needs products. He and his wife manage the store. 

With the capital provided, he will buy soap, oil, sugar, a variety of snacks and other items. His goal is to have his store well-stocked in order to generate greater earnings that will enable him to improve his economic situation and pay the debt he has acquired. He will also be able to satisfy his customers' needs and attract new customers. His dreams are to offer his family a better life, and for his children to have the opportunity to receive a superior education to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, sugar and a variety of snacks.

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es: Liliana, a sus 27 años de edad, es casada y madre de una hija de 8 años. Se ha dedicado a ser ama de casa y en algunas temporadas vende mercancía sobre pedido para poder generar sus propios ingresos y aportar a la economía del hogar; hace aproximadamente 4 meses su esposo adquirió una pequeña camioneta con el fin de generar un ingreso adicional para su familia, con el vehículo ella  podría prestar el servicio de transporte de equipos de cómputo, fotocopiadoras y de estudiantes, contando con la ventaja de que la empresa en la que labora su esposo, solicitan constantemente el servicio de transporte, por lo que ya tienen un ingreso fijo. Su espíritu de superación, su entusiasmo y las ganas de cambiar de actividad, le han permitido obtener buenos resultados con este negocio. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la adecuación del vehículo (adecuar el piso para proteger tanto el carro, como los equipos que transporta, cambiar el forro de la silletería), de esta manera podrá prestar un mejor servicio y tendrá la oportunidad de adquirir nuevos contratos, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de los ingresos que recibe por su labor. De esta manera, Liliana desea seguir trabajando y contribuir con la economía del hogar, además desea tener la posibilidad de ahorrar para adquirir una casa propia y así ofrecer a su pequeña hija, un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liliana is 27 years old, married and the mother of an eight-year-old girl. She has spent her time as a housewife and at times sells merchandise on order in order to make a living and support her home. 

About four months ago, her husband acquired a small van with the purpose of generating additional income for the family. With this van, she will be able to offer transportation services for computer equipment, photocopy machines, and students. Her husband has the advantage of working for a business in which transportation is often requested, and she now has a consistent income. 

Her drive to succeed, as well as her enthusiasm and desire to change her daily activity have allowed her to have success with this business. She is currently requesting a loan to invest in vehicle repairs including fixing the floor to protect the vehicle and equipment that she transports, and to change the seat lining. In this way, she will be able to offer better service and have the opportunity to secure new contracts, which will be reflected in the earnings that she receives for her work. Liliana wants to continue working and contribute to the household economy. She also hopes to have the opportunity to save money in order to buy a house of her own so that she can offer her young daughter an improved well-being and standard of living.

loans.use:
to carry out vehicle repairs including fixing up the floor to protect the vehicle and equipment that she transports,as well as to change the seat lining. 

Realizar adecuación del vehículo (adecuar el piso para proteger tanto el carro, como los equipos que transporta, cambiar el forro de la silletería)

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Rafael está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comités, es u grupo nuevo que tiene muchas expectativas, quieren poder capacitarse y llegar a ser grandes líderes. Además ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus vidas.
Blanca es miembro activo de esta grupo, ella está muy contenta por formar parte de este grupo, ya que podrá capacitarse e ir mejorando día a día. Ella comenta que por medio de su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y que quiere poder seguir trabajando para mejorar su economía y la de su familia. Se dedica a la venta de comidas, y pide de este préstamo para poder comprar carne, verduras, condimentos, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
The San Rafael group is in its first cycle of the committee program. It is a new group that has many expectations - they want to be able to become well-trained and become greater leaders. The women form part of the poverty elimination group so that they can improve their lives. 

Blanca is an active member of this group. She is very satisfied to be part of the group because she will be able to receive training and improve each day. She comments that through her efforts she is getting ahead and wants to continue improving her economic situation, as well as that of her family. She makes a living selling food and is requesting this loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other supplies to continue working and fighting for her goals.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables. condiments and other supplies.

loans.name: Altantsogt

texts.en:
Altantsogt is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Onorjargal is 35 and helps her husband to run their family business of manufacturing wooden furniture.  His 2 daughters attend local primary school and kindergarten respectively. 
Altantsogt has been crafting wooden Ger parts and furniture since 1998. He has built close relationships with his suppliers and clients as well. He takes orders from clients and manufactures furniture or other products to meet the client's order.  He stopped his business for a while and started providing transportation service with a truck but now he would like to return to furniture manufacturing.  He is requesting loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase plank and other inventory to produce wooden furniture for local clients.  He is a hardworking, enthusiastic and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase plank and other inventory to produce wooden furniture for local clients.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Virginia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, and canned goods, for her general store business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell including soap, milk, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soap, rice, curls, and other groceries for her general store business.

Leonila has been in this business for 2 years. Leonila earns more income from food vending and raising pigs.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional general store items to sell

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña Ana es originaria de Chinandega. De 31 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de queso. Inició su actividad con poco producto (queso) y ayuda de su mamá la cual le proporciono un pequeño capital para que lograra establecer su negocio.
Ana es una  mujer emprendedora, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha mantenido estable su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: queso al por mayor con el fin de abastecer a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas e ingresos. Su plan futuro es comprar un medio de transporte (camioneta) para comercializar su producto en varios puntos de la ciudad.
texts.en: Ana is from Chinandega. She is 31 years old, married, and has a son. She is a vendor and sells cheese. She started her business with a small quantity of her product (cheese) and with the help of her mother, who gave her a small quantity of cash to set up her business. Ana is a hard-working woman and has managed to keep her business going through a lot of hard work and dedication. She is requesting a loan to buy cheese at wholesale to sell to her customers. She believes that the loan will be very helpful as it will  enable her to increase her sales and her income. Her future plan is to buy a means of transport (van) to be able to sell her product in different parts of the city.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Dinah is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dinah has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is managing her own piggery as an aid to her husband's income from employment. She has two children who are still studying. Aside from this, she has had a buy and sell business. She always finds ways to augment their living. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase feeds for the livestock. She wants to use her returns to repair the livestock's shelter for expansion. In the future, she wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for the livestocks

loans.name: Franca

texts.en:
Franca works hard to support her family. Franca is married and has a business making native bags in the Philippines.

Franca requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for making bags.

Franca has been in this business for 15 years now.  In the future, Franca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bags.

loans.name: Sayatin

texts.en:
Sayatin is 40 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Sayatin is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers .

Sayatin has been farming coconut for 35 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling crabs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Melinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 54 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dionisia has a computer gaming machine business in the Philippines. Dionisia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional computer for her business.

Dionisia has been in this business for 13 years. Dionisia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his old car with better second hand car to continue providing transportation service

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Nerissa, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nerissa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them as individual pieces. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nerissa dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Davinson Alejandro

texts.es: Davinson es un joven emprendedor que, a sus 20 años de edad, ya es un chef; luego de culminar sus estudios de gastronomía en una entidad educativa. Con el ánimo, el entusiasmo y la energía típicos de su edad, desea iniciar su propia casa de banquetes, para aprovechar el conocimiento y la práctica que adquirió en el transcurso de sus estudios, allí desea atender diversos eventos sociales y deleitar a los clientes con sus exquisitas recetas, actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, sin embargo, debe comprar los utensilios de cocina, una estufa industrial, un enfriador e insumos, razón por la cual solicita el apoyo del crédito, pues con él podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, con éste espera generar los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Davinson es consciente que para lograr sus objetivos debe trabajar con mucho empeño, dedicación, disciplina y constancia, sólo así podrá cumplir el sueño de tener un gran restaurante exclusivo y generar mejores ingresos para su familia, lo que le dará la capacidad de ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Davinson is a young entrepreneur who, at the age of 20, is already a chef, after completing his studies in gastronomy at an educational institution. With the spirit, the enthusiasm, and the energy typical of his age, he wants to set up his own banquet hall to take advantage of the knowledge and practice that he acquired in the course of his studies. There he wants to cater various social events and delight customers with his exquisite recipes. At this time he has the support of his parents; nevertheless, he needs to buy cooking utensils, an industrial stove, a cooler, and supplies. For this reason, he is applying for the support of a loan, since with it he will be able to start his productive project. With this he hopes to generate sufficient income to contribute to his household economy. Davinson is aware that to reach his goals he needs to work with great effort, dedication, discipline, and perseverance. Only in this way will he be able to accomplish his dream of having a big, exclusive restaurant and generating better income for his family, which will give him the ability to offer them a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils, an industrial stove, a cooler, and supplies.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Ritchel has been in this business for two years. Ritchel earns additional income from fishing and a general store.

Ritchel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 33 años, realizo sus estudios de bachillerato general.  Actualmente, está soltero vive con su madre y sus dos hermanos, quienes también se dedican a la artesanía como él. 

Arturo se dedica a la prestación de servicio en un molino de maíz, actividad que la desempeña hace  12 años; aprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que un vecino tenía molinos y él se acercaba a ver, para aprender la actividad que realiza hoy en día.  Además, las horas libres se  dedica a elaborar artesanías de barro como son cómales y ollas, actividad que realiza desde sus 12 años de edad. Los molino de maíz está a 500 metros de su casa y se traslada a pie sus horas de trabajo son  de 3:00 AM – 7:00 AM por la mañana y por la medio día de 11.00 AM – 12:30 PM y por la tarde de 4:00 PM – 5:30 PM.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ollas y cómales crudos y él los quema para luego distribuirlos al mercado de la ciudad y esto le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos económicas. 

Arturo, quiere establecer una tienda de artesanías en el municipio, con el  apoyo de su madre y sus hermanos que también se dedican a esta actividad y disponer de diferentes estilos de productos artesanos, para venderlos con los turistas que frecuenta el municipio.

El préstamo le permitirá realizar compras de más material, para sacarlo a vender al mercado y obtener mayores ingresos económicos y de las ganancias obtenidas las invertirá en más mercadería con fin de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Arturo is 33 years old and a high school graduate. He is single, lives with his mother and two siblings who also work as artisans like he does.

Arturo provides service grinding corn, something he has been doing for 12 years. He learned this on by his own initiative as he had a neighbor who had three mills and Arturo used to watch him in order to learn the work he does today. In addition, during his free time he works as an artisan making pots and pan, something he has done since he was 12 years old. The corn mill is 500 meters from his home and he goes by foot to work. He works 3:00 AM - 7:00 AM in the morning, 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM midday, and 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM in the afternoon.  

The loan he seeks is to buy unfinished pots and pans that he then fires and distributes in the city market, enabling him to obtain greater economic income.

Arturo wants to open an artisan market in the town, with the support of his mother and siblings who also work as artisans and make different styles of products to sell to the tourists that visit the area.

The loan will enable him to purchase more materials to then sell in the market and obtain greater income; he will invest the earnings in more merchandise with the goal of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy unfinished pots and pans to fire and later sell in the market.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam has always been cooking and working at food establishments. He started his own deli shop in Kendall Park about one year ago and has been doing well despite his lack of formal education or business training. Superior customer service sets Sam’s business apart from the rest. The varied and extensive menu is another distinction – Bagellicious serves not only bagels but gyros and a variety of Mediterranean foods as well. Sam is said to be flexible and is willing to prepare almost any food his clients ask for.

With this loan, Sam is able to employ a handful of staff and invest in better marketing, for example, a billboard on Route 27 to gain more exposure for his business.

loans.use: To create jobs at a Lebanese deli and helps to increase visibility of his shop

loans.name: Eucario De Jesús

texts.es: Eucario nació en el seno de una familia humilde en un pueblo del occidente antioqueño; durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar prestando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros dentro del pueblo donde vive y en veredas cercanas; la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos económicos para sostener a su familia, conformada por su esposa y su único hijo, aprovechando la ventaja de que el pueblo es reconocido por ser un lugar muy turístico y llamativo, además cuenta con clientela fija ya que es reconocido por ser uno de los pioneros en prestar este tipo de servicio de transporte en moto; trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 9:00 pm para aprovechar la afluencia de personas de la región y los turistas que llegan a visitar el pueblo. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de realizar mantenimiento al vehículo, comprar repuestos y cancelar el saldo que tiene pendiente para cancelar la totalidad del valor de la moto; esto le permitirá brindar mayor seguridad a sus pasajeros, pues de ellos depende la continuidad en su labor, especialmente en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, en la que el turismo de la región aumenta y por ende se beneficia de ello para aumentar sus ingresos. Eucario sólo desea seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia, ofrecerles una estabilidad económica favorable que les permita disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en unión.
texts.en:
Eucario was born into a humble family in a town in western Antioquia. During his working years he has been lending his services taxiing passengers in the town where he lives and in neighboring areas. He came to this idea due to the need to generate income in order to provide for his family, made up of his wife and his only child. He can take advantage of the fact that the town is well known as a striking tourist destination, and he also has regular customers seeing as he is recognized as one of the pioneers in this type of work as a motorcycle taxi. He works everyday from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm to take advantage of the abundance of people from the region and the tourists who come to visit the town. 

Currently Eucario is requesting this loan in order to complete maintenance on his vehicle, purchase spare parts, and pay down the remaining balance on the value of the motorcycle. This will allow him to bring a greater level of security to his passengers, as they depend on the continuity of his work, especially during the coming holiday season in which the tourism in the region, and thus his income, increases. Eucario only wishes to continue safeguarding the wellbeing of his family, offering them a good level of economic stability that will allow them to enjoy a better quality of life together.

loans.use: complete maintenance on his vehicle, purchase spare parts, and pay off the remaining balance on his motorcycle so it is completely paid off.

loans.name: Yuri Linet

texts.es: Yuri tiene 24 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada con mucho esfuerzo a la venta de ropa y zapatos. Negocio que inicio hace tres años. Ella es una joven soltera con sueños de crecer en el negocio y tener una tienda establecida en una de las zonas de la ciudad, toda su vida ha luchado para tener una vida mejor, cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá que nunca la deja sola. Su producto es de mucha demanda por sus clientes, los cuales la visitan por que ofrece una variedad de mercadería y por el servicio que les brinda. Solicita un crédito para  comprar: pantalones, camisas, short, entre otros, con el fin de seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Estima que este crédito le será muy beneficioso ya que lograra incrementar sus ganancias  y ayudar economicamente a su mama.
texts.en: Yuri is 24 years old and originally from the city of León.  She is a business-woman and puts a lot of effort into selling clothes and shoes.  She has had the business for three years.  Yuri is single and has dreams of expanding the business and having a shop in the city.  Yuri has fought all her life to have a better life.  She is supported by her mother, who has never left her alone.  Yuri's products are in great demand by her customers, who come to visit her and see the variety of merchandise and enjoy the good service provided.  Yuri is applying for this loan in order to buy trousers, shirts, shorts, and more, in order to fulfil her customers' demands.  Yuri thinks this loan will be of great help to her as, with it, she will be able to increase her profits and give financial support to her mother.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, shorts, and more.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, ella reside con sus hijos y esposo en una aldea del municipio de Concepción del Sur, Santa Bárbara.  Ella inicio con su propio negocio de una pulpería. y hace 4 años inicio realizando la actividad de cría y venta de cerdos. Su mercado es local para vender los cerdos. Ángela ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal, por su parte es de 15,000 Lempiras para comprar concentrados y vitaminas para mantener en buen estado de salud a los cerdos y poder tener mejor venta en esta época de fin de año. Su plan es mejorar la condición de vida familiar y que sus hijos tengan buena educación. 
el grupo al que pertenece se llama Nueva Esperanza y esta formada por 4 integrantes, quienes viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a realizar actividades agrícolas. El préstamo grupal es por 41,000 lempiras y los invertirán en la compra de concentrados y vitaminas para los cerdos que crían y venden.
En la fotografía se identifican de izquierda a derecha así: Ángela tiene blusa rayada, seguido esta José con camisa color morado, Wendi con blusa rosada y Mario de camiseta verde.
texts.en:
Angela is 45 years old, married and has four children.  She lives with her husband and children in the municipality of Concepción del Sur, in Santa Bárbara.  Angela started with a grocery store and four years ago started a business raising and selling pigs.  She sells the pigs locally.  Angela is applying for a group loan.  She will take 15,000 Lempira of this loan in order to buy feed and vitamins to keep the pigs in good health and so that she will have higher sales at the end of the year.  Angela's plan is to improve her family's quality of life and to give her children a good upbringing.

Angela belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza" group, made up of four members who live in the same community.  They all work in farming.  The group is applying for a loan of 41,000 Lempira, which will be invested in buying feed and vitamins for pigs that they will raise and sell.

In the photograph, from left to right, are Angela, José, Wendi, and Mario.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for pigs.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea dreams of becoming an architect but knows it may never be possible without a degree. Andrea was accepted into the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in December 2013 but is unsure how she will be able to afford her education without a loan. She shares that her alternative is to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Andrea says that it is important for her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible.

Andrea plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies with this loan. With the proper books, Andrea feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. To help afford her school and living expenses, Andrea currently works 30 hours a week in addition to her responsibilities at school. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in architecture, she expects to earn $15 a day – a substantial increase from before. Andrea hopes to be a role model for her younger brother by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Videkon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIDEKON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupe, nommée Gbelognon Anastasie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 43 ans. Gbelognon Anastasie a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Gbelognon Anastasie est mariée à un certain Nicolas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Gbelognon Anastasie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Gbelognon Anastasie achète des sachets qu'elle revend de façon ambulante depuis huit ans. Gbelognon Anastasie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Gbelognon Anastasie s’associe aux autres membres du groupe VIDEKON pour solliciter un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group VIDEKON comprises three persons who reside in the same district and who run revenue-generating businesses. The group's representative, Gbelognon Anastasie (with her hand raised in the photo), is 43 years old and has a primary school education. She is married to a man named Nicolas. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. The household expenses are covered by the couple. For this reason, Gbelognon Anastasie purchases pouches [often containing drinking water] that she has been selling door to door for eight years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business, Gbelognon Anastasie joined with the other members of the group VIDEKON to request a fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase pouches [often containing drinking water].

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Cibanguka  est une conseillère du collectif de crédit  « Esther», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 31 ans  et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle s’entraide avec son conjoint dans les affaires. La cliente est une vendeuse des souliers.  Elle installe  ses articles à un point de vente animé et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 15 paires de souliers.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce. La vente en crédit et les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Cibanguka, is an advisor of the loan collective "Esther". She is a young entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 31 years old, and a mother of four children, who are all students. She and her husband assist each other in business matters. This client is a vendor of shoes. She sets up her good at a busy sales outlet and sometimes at her home. She started her business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for four years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 15 pairs shoes. Thus, she would like to provide schooling to her children and to expand her business project. Challenges for developing her business include selling on credit and exchange losses.  

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 15 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Carola

texts.en:
Carola dreams of becoming a customs official but knows it may never be possible without a degree. To achieve her goal, Carola has enrolled in Instituro de Comercio Exterior Angel Rassmusen. She plans on graduating in December 2014 but, without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation.

To help afford her school and living expenses, Carola currently works as a nanny. Carola plans on using this loan to pay her tuition while she saves her salary from her part-time job. With a career in customs administration, she expects to earn $17 a day – a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling attending college already, Carola is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without this help.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana Isabel mayor de edad casada con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, entre otros mas, Ana es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación personal, ella inicia su negocio de ventas y elaboración de cajetas de coco, leche, entre otros su negocio es de forma ambulante, los cuales ofrece a clientes fijos y eventuales, ademas de este negocio tiene una pequeña pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo para el hogar como: arroz, azucar, frijoles, pan, golosinas, cremas, jugos, gaseosas, popsicles entre otros, el objetivo de este credito es para  invertir en su pulperia y venta de cajetas, en los cuales necesita comprar materia prima para ambos negocios, como: coco, azucar, leña, arroz, frijoles, aceite, detergentes entre otros mas.
texts.en: Ana Isabel is an elderly, married woman with five grown children. She is from the Chinandega area, a predominantly commercial and tourism area. One of many, Ana is a woman with a strong personal desire to get ahead. She has started a business making and selling caramels with coconut, milk, and other ingredients. She works as a street vendor, selling to regular and prospective customers. In addition to this business she operates a small grocery store where she offers staple household goods such as rice, sugar, beans, bread, sweets, creams, juices, soft drinks, popsicles, and other items. The goal for this loan is to invest in her grocery store and sale of caramels. She needs to purchase primary materials for both businesses, such as chocolate, sugar, firewood, rice, beans, oil, detergents, and other items.

loans.use: purchase primary materials for household consumption and for making caramels.

loans.name: Jesús Alfonso

texts.es: Jesús, a sus 26 años de edad, se desempeña como practicante de contabilidad en una empresa de asesorías ubicada en el pueblo donde reside pero, con el ánimo de generar los ingresos por cuenta propia, desea iniciar un proyecto productivo, un negocio de comidas rápidas ya que posee conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios, pues a los 18 años tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar en este campo de acción. Su espíritu emprendedor, su entusiasmo y las ganas de superarse y progresar lo impulsan para solicitar el crédito con el que desea comprar un carro de perros, utensilios de cocina y surtido al por mayor (panes, salsas, carnes frías, quesos, gaseosas, entre otros), así podrá poner en marcha su idea de negocio, con el que espera generar los recursos necesarios para apoyar a su familia con la carga económica del hogar, además tiene la ventaja de tener conocimientos en contabilidad, lo que le permitirá llevar un mayor control en sus entradas y salidas para hacer de esta actividad, una fuente de ingresos rentable y sostenible en el tiempo. Jesús, manifiesta sus ansias para iniciar con su proyecto, pues desea acreditarlo y darse a conocer en el sector y, en un futuro poder montar su negocio en un local comercial bien ubicado, con mayor afluencia de personas, generando mayores ingresos para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Jesús, at the age of 26, works as a practicioner of accounting in a consulting business located in the town where he lives. But, in the spirit of generating income on his own account, he wants to begin a productive project, a fast food business, since he has knowledge about the management of this type of business because he had the opportunity to work in this field at the age of 18. His entrepreneurial spirit, his enthusiasm, and his will to achieve and progress drive him to apply for the loan, with which he wants to buy a fast-food cart, cooking utensils, and wholesale stock (breads, salsas, cold meats, cheeses, and soft drinks, among other items). Thus he will be able to start up his business idea, with which he hopes to generate the necessary income to assist his family with the economic burden of the household. Furthermore, he has the advantage of having knowledge in accounting, which will allow him to better track his income and expenditures in order to make this business a source of income that in time is profitable and sustainable. Jesús shows his eagerness to start his project, since he wants to get a reputation and become known in the district and in the future be able to set up his business in a well-located commercial location with a greater flow of people, generating greater income to offer his family a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a fast-food cart, cooking utensils, and wholesale stock (breads, salsas, cold meats, cheeses, and soft drinks, among other items)

loans.name: Susita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a beauty parlor. Susita is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Susita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Group 12 - An Thanh 01

texts.en:
Mrs. Trieu, 58, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND ($33). She is married and has three children in high school. 

Her family does not have a sanitary, hygienic toilet facility in their home. However, she is participating in a campaign through her local Women's Union to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene. With a portion of this loan, Trieu will use the funds to build a sanitary toilet with a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap that will improve living conditions, improve the health of family members and help protect the environment. 

In the photo, Trieu stands from first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 1 - An Thanh 01

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha, pictured first on the right in the first row, is 23 years old and has a little kid. She works in the rice paddies and makes about $35 (750,000 VND) a month. 

Mrs. Ha has been an active member of Hai Duong Women Union since 2009. Recently, she joined a campaign to improve her community's sanitation and hygiene. A portion of Group 1 - An Thanh 01's loan will help Ha as well as other group members build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap that will improve her family's hygiene and quality of life and contribute to the overall health of the community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 31 years old and married with three children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of dry goods business in the Philippines, and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell like blouses, shirts, pants, etc.

Juliet has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dry-goods business for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

Juliet aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell like blouses, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Group 2 - An Thanh 01

texts.en:
Ms. Thanh, 63 years old, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND (Vietnamese dong). She is divorced and lives with one adult son and her elderly mother. 

She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2003, where she found out about a campaign to improve local sanitation and hygiene. Currently, her family does not have a safe toilet that flushes. A portion of Group 2 at An Thanh 01's loan will help Thanh as well as other group members build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, improve the health of families throughout her community and help protect the environment. 

In the photo, she stands first on the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es: La  Alcancía Comunal “Emanuel” está conformada por 08 socios trabajadores que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Serlay la cual se dedica a la compra y venta de ajíes, donde luego son distribuidas en mercados de su localidad. Gracias a su esfuerzo Serlay ha mejorado la calidad de vida de su familia. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ajíes. Su mayor deseo es de seguir implementando su negocio. El grupo “Emanuel” agradece el crédito brindado  y se compromete a seguir trabajando bien. Serlay se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo color lila, en brazos lleva a su menor hija.
texts.en: The "Emanuel" Community Savings Group is made up of eight hardworking members who are looking to make each day better. So it is for Serlay, who works buying and selling chile peppers, which are later distributed in markets in her town. Thanks to her effort, Serlay has improved the quality of life for her family. For this reason she is requesting the loan in order to keep investing in the purchase of peppers. Her greatest desire is to keep doing her work. The "Emanuel" Group is grateful for the loan provided and promises to keep working hard. Serlay is pictured above, sitting on the right in the lilly-colored shirt, holding her youngest daughter in her arms.

loans.use: purchase chile peppers.

loans.name: Leslie Tatiana

texts.es: Leslie   de 21 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de obstetricia   estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres, Leslie  ha sabido salir adelante estudiar mucho y  así culminar sus estudios y así poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula universitaria y la compra de útiles de estudio que necesita. Leslie  se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con un fuerte abrazo ah Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Leslie is 21 years old, single, and without children.  She is a friendly student in the school of obstetrics.  She studies a lot in order to reach her goals in life.  With the help of her parents, Leslie has managed to come out ahead in life and to study a lot, so as to complete her education and to be able to be successful in life.  

With the loan granted to her, Leslie will be able to pay for her university enrollment and to buy the learning tools that she needs.  Leslie is very grateful for the help she has been offered, and she says goodbye to Kiva with a big hug, telling them that she will fulfill her promise to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment and to buy learning tools.

loans.name: Group 6 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Mrs. Khuyen, 31 years old, works in agriculture production where she earns a monthly income of about 700,000 VND (about $33). She is married and has two small children. Currently, their family uses an unsafe, unhygienic latrine. However, her local women's union, where she has been a member since 2003, has recently started a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene. A portion of Group 6 - An Thanh 01's loan will help Khuyen as well as other group members build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. In the photo, Khuyen stands on the first to the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Josan

texts.en: Josan, a 21-year-old with three children, manages her own retail store for a living. She has been working in this line of business for three years, along with farming. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. Hopefully, she will be able to sustain her business for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

location.town: Poblacion, South Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Marilu Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marilu de 52 años,  estudio hasta 6ª grado. Actualmente, está acompañada, su esposo no realiza ningún trabajo actualmente, ya que se encuentra en mal estado de salud,  tiene un hijo que estudia en la universidad doctorado y está efectuando su último año para graduarse.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que tiene 27 años de dedicarse a la venta de la comida, la cual fue iniciativa propia de iniciarse en esta actividad. Desde entonces se ha venido formado con apoyo de algunas instituciones para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Además de esta actividad tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad, la cual le genera ingresos para los gastos de la familia y tiene 18 años de verla establecido en su casa; sus horas de trabajo es de las 5:00 AM hasta 7:00 PM.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  4 cajas de tomate, 2 sacos de papas, 3 cajas de chile, 3 quintales de maíz, 2 quintales de frijol y 2 quintales de azúcar ; para surtir su tienda.
Desea, crecer económicamente para mantener su tienda y su comedor para sacar adelante su negocio y  para su familia espera que su hijo se gradué de doctorado en medicina.
texts.en:
Marilu is 52 years old; she studied up to 6th grade. Currently, she is married. Her husband isn’t working at the moment, as he is having health problems. She has one child who is a PhD student and is in his last year before graduating. 

She works selling food, a job that she has had for 27 years. She started doing this work on her own initiative. Since then, she has gone on with the support of some organizations to offer better services to her customers. 

In addition to this work, she has a small general store, which generates income for her family’s expenses. It has been set up in her house for 18 years. Her work hours are from 5:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of 4 boxes of tomatoes, 2 sacks of potatoes, 2 boxes of chiles, 3 quintals of corn, 2 quintals of beans and 2 quintals of sugar to stock her store. 

She wishes to grow economically to maintain her store and restaurant in order to move her business ahead. For her family, she hopes that her son will graduate with his doctorate in medicine.

loans.use: to purchase 4 boxes of tomatoes, 2 sacks of potatoes, 2 boxes of chiles, 3 quintals of corn, 2 quintals of beans and 2 quintals of sugar to stock her store.

loans.name: Group 8 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Mrs. Xiem is 44 years old. She works in the agriculture sector with a monthly income of about 700,000 VND ($33). She is married and has one child in high school. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1989 and recently found out about her community issues with sanitation and hygiene. Currently, her family is using an unhygienic, unsafe latrine. A portion of Group 8 - An Thanh 01's loan will help Xiem as well as other group members build a sanitary toilet with septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap that will improve the living conditions and health of many families and help protect the environment. In the photo, Xiem stands first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
This is Leonila, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Leonila manufactures gloves. She buys materials and then makes gloves to be sold. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.
 
Leonila dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed in making gloves, like cloth, fabric, needles and other materials.

loans.name: Group 11 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Mrs. Muon, 44 years old, works in agriculture and earns a monthly income of approximately 750.000 VND ($35). Her husband has passed away and she is raising two sons in high school by herself. She recently joined a campaign to promote sanitation and hygiene through her local Women's Union, where she has been a member since 1989. Currently, her family does not have access to a hygienic, sanitary toilet facility. Like other group members of Group 11 - An Thanh 01, Muon will use the loan to build a toilet with septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, improve the health of family members and contribute to environmental protection. In the picture, Muon is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Kirana

texts.en:
Kirana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanut, sugar, cooking oil, etc., for her food vending business.

Kirana has been in this business for 25 years. Kirana earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Kirana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es: Hilda de 54 años es casada con 02 hijos independientes, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Sagrada Familia” conformada por 08 mujeres forjadoras. Hilda se dedica a las confecciones y venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lleva más de 06 años desempeñándose de esta manera. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro, donde le permita transportar sus prendas y así poder entregar sus pedidos a tiempos. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de materiales como telas, hilos y tijeras. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Hilda se encuentra en la parte posterior, viste polo rosado y chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
Hilda is 54 years old. She is married with 2 independent children. She currently belongs to the group “Sagrada Familia” (Holy Family) made up of 8 striving women. 

Hilda works making and selling clothing; she has been doing this for more than 6 years. Her greatest wish is to buy a car, which would allow her to transport her garments and therefore fill her orders on time. 

The loan that she requested will be used for the purchase of fabric, thread, and scissors. The group “Sagrada Familia” is grateful to the people who made this loan possible. 

Hilda is in the back, wearing a pink shirt and gray vest.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fabric, thread and scissors.

loans.name: Lyn Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad urbana de cayalti donde su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo que se encuentra en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia joven que se esfuerza por tener mejores condiciones de vida, Jonathan se dedica a la actividad de servicio de soldadura metálica y mantenimiento de motos y mototaxis, desde hace mas de 5 años su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar un equipo de soldadura y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 28 years old and lives with his wife and children in the urban community of Cayalti, where its population makes a living through commerce and agriculture.  It is an hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

They are a young family that makes a great effort to have better living conditions.  Jonathan makes a living through metal welding work and maintaining motorcycles and motorcycle-taxis, which he has done for more than five years.  His business is located in his home.  He has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles in order to buy welding equipment and in this way offer better service to his clients.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón” conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y dinámicas, la cual pasan a su 6 ciclo. Janet de 37 años casada con 07 hijos independiente. Hace más de 3 años que cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda. Producto de su esfuerzo es que ha mejorado su casa y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y bebidas. Su mayor anhelo es de seguir mejorando su tienda. El grupo “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito, la cual contribuye en su progreso. Janet se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste polo blanco con rayas negras y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
This is the group “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón”, made up of 6 enterprising and dynamic women and in its 6th loan cycle. 

Janet is 37 years old and married with 7 independent children. For more than 3 years, she has had a store in her home. As a product of her efforts, she has improved her house and supported her household expenses. 

With the goal of making continued improvement, she requested the loan for the purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and drinks. Her greatest desire is to continue improving her store. The group “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón” is grateful to the people who made this loan possible, which contributes to their progress. 

Janet is seated second from the left, wearing a white shirt with black stripes and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and drinks.

loans.name: Wilma Francisca

texts.es: Wilma Francisca mayor de edad soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, responsable con su obligaciones, honesta, con muchos deseos de superacion tanto personal como laboral, ella desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar para poder ayudar con las gastos familiares en su hogar ella viene de una familia muy pobre que con costo logro terminar su secundaria en modalidad sabatino y semanal ella trabaja, es así como ella logra tener su propio negocio de una pequeña mini tienda donde ofrece productos como:blusas, pantalones, camisetas, chores, cosméticos, sandalias al igual que también tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde confecciona ropa nueva actualmente esta confeccionado togas de preescolar y primaria de diferentes centros escolares, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como: telas, hilo, agujas, botones, siperes, tijeras, centímetro, entretelas, broches, cintas, entre otros mas. Wilma esta muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos
texts.en:
Wilma Francisca is a single adult with three children, and is originally from one of the towns of Chinandega.  She is known for being a hard-working woman, responsible with her duties, honest, and for having much desire to improve both personally and in work.  At a young age she began to work in order to help her family with household expenses.  She comes from a very poor family.  With a cost, she managed to finish secondary school through means of saturday school because she worked weekly.  

This is how she managed to have her own business; a small mini-mart where she offers products like blouses, pants, t-shirts, shorts, cosmetics, and sandals.  Likewise, she also has a small sewing workshop where she makes new clothing.  Right now she is making preschool and elementary school gowns.

The purpose of this loan is so that she can buy raw materials like fabric, thread, needles, buttons, zippers, scissors, measuring tape, lining, fasteners, and tape, among other items.  Wilma is very happy and grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders have offered to people with little financial resources.

loans.use: to buy raw material like fabric, zippers, buttons, needles, thread, lining, and a measuring tape, among other items.

loans.name: Zayda Rafaela

texts.es: Zayda es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 33 años de edad, casada y madre de 1 hijo. De oficio comerciante, dedicada a la venta de joyas de plata, negocio que lo inicio hace pocos año, el cual fue incrementado su clientela. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes nuevos debido a las recomendaciones de sus clientes anteriores y actuales. Su meta próxima es incrementar su negocio con ventas de productos de marca como perfumes, crema etc. Solicita el crédito para comprar bisuterías de plata como: anillos, cadena, pulseras entre otros, con el fin de incrementar su mercadería y ofrecer productos de calidad. Estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda porque aumentara sus ganancias y podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es tener un negocio más grande en la parte central de la ciudad, y ofrecer buenas ofertas e incrementar su demanda.
texts.en: Zayda is from the city of Boaco and is 33 years old, married and the mother of one son. She is a retailer and works selling silver jewelry, a business that she started a few years ago and whose customers have increased over the years. She now has new customers thanks to the recommendations from previous and current customers. Her next goal is to grow her business by adding more products to her inventory such as perfumes, creams, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets etc, in order to increase her merchandise and offer quality products. She believes that this loan will be of great use as it will help her to increase her profits and she will be able to fulfill her customers' demands. Her future plan is to have a bigger business in the center of the city and to be able to offer good prices and increase the demand for her products.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry like rings, chains, bracelets etc.

loans.name: Yrysbubu

texts.ru: Ырысбюбю 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Ырысбюбю - среднее образование, в данное время занимается торговлей швейными и трикотажными изделиями на местном рынке, кроме этого Ырысбюбю занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ырысбюбю и в торговле и в животноводстве, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, а также Ырысбюбю арендует 2,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, сеет зерновые культуры. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ырысбюбю обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ырысбюбю планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также хочет улучшить свое материальное положение, улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Yrysbubu is 52 years old, married, and raising one son with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  She currently sells sewing and knitting items at a local market and is also involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She started in this business 15 years ago, when she first bought livestock for 35,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work both as a retailer and as a cattle breeder, she currently owns two dairy cows and two horses.  Yrysbubu also rents two hectares of allotted land on which she cultivates potatoes and other crops every year.  She makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her business, Yrysbubu has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some cows in order to increase her cattle headcount.

Yrysbubu plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She would also like to improve her circumstances and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Group 7 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Mrs. Chinh is 48 years old. She is married and has 3 grown children. Currently, Chinh assists her husband, who is the breadwinner of the family, through agricultural production. Together they earn a total monthly income of about 1,600,000 VND ($75). Currently, the family is using an unhygienic latrine. However, the local Women's Union, where Chinh has been a member since 1987, started a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene. A portion of Group 7 - An Thanh 01's loan will help Chinh as well as other group members build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve the living conditions and health of the community while also contributing to environmental protection. In the image, she stands fourth from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Baigalmaa is 47 and lives with her family in a ger (traditional nomadic yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Erdenebat, and older daughter are herders and breed and take care of their livestock. Her son and younger daughter are university students in Ulaanbaatar city. 
Baigalmaa has been working as a veterinarian for years and started selling medicine from a rental booth in 2009. She sells seasonal vaccination and now the season is coming and she needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of vaccines and other medicine for the livestock of the town. She is a hardworking, caring and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of vaccines and other medicine for the livestock of the town

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from meal vending. Lucy is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar and noodles for her general store.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Joevy

texts.en:
Joevy is 35 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Joevy has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for making mats.

Joevy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Joevy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making mats

loans.name: Cyna

texts.en:
Cyna is 29 years old and married.

Cyna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa roof-making business in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, and other materials for her business.

Cyna has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roof-making business for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Cyna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her general store. Her earnings were a big help toward her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rose dreams that her business will be more successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine is running a manufacturing business making hollow blocks for sale. She also is engaged in vending food in their community as an aid to her husband's income from employment as a private driver. She earns enough for the needs of her only child and for the family. Currently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC, which she had joined to purchase materials like sand and gravel. She wants to improve her business and be able to serve and offer employment in their community. In the future, she wants to become successful in her business and be able to provide a comfortable living situation for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like sand and gravel

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
This is Risa, 28, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alejandro, her business partner, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Risa operates an auto repair shop. Her husband is the main mechanic while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair, check-up and beautification of all types of cars and jeepneys, any type of vehicle that will be referred to them.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like wiring, putty paint and others of the like. 

Risa hopes that her business will be a great success and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like wiring, putty paint and others of the like.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife, Altantuya, is currently unemployed and takes care of the family at home. His son, Erhembayar, is 15 and a local school student. His 4-year-old daughter, Bayasgalan, attends a local kindergarten. 

Batjargal has been providing auto repair services for four years and also now works part time as driver in an administrative office. He and his wife are planning to insulate the house before the harsh, cold Mongolian winter comes and is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to install for winter preparation. Batjargal is a hardworking and responsible man who is passionate about taking care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to install for winter preparation.

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Levie works hard to support her family.

She has a mat weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Levie is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for making mats.

Levie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making mats.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Khea

texts.en:
Khea is 47 years old and has seven children. It’s a big family, so Khea and her husband need to work very hard to provide enough for them. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening and rice farming in Kampong Thom province, whereas her husband is engaged in fishing activities. Through their hardships, they can make a good income of KHR 35,000 per day.

Khea wants to ensure that she can have a fruitful harvest and good growth of her pigs, so she applied for a loan to help her achieve her plans. She will use it to buy additional pigs for raising and fertilizers for her rice crops. She believes that she can make her family-owned businesses more viable and profitable in the near future. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs for raising and fertilizers for her rice crops.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Susan works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Susan is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and widowed with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries. Maribel has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maribel aspires to save money to build and expand her business.
