loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, noodles, and other groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 40 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 24 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable seeds to sell. She has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds to sell for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Francisca is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. Francisca has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetables stall.

loans.name: Kuni

texts.en:
Kuni is a 41-year-old divorced woman. She lives in the Odagaon village of Odisha, India, with her brother and sister-in-law. She is engaged in an activity of tailoring and earns 3000 INR per month. 

She did not want to place any burden on her brother for herself; that is why she started this business eight years before. 

Kuni is requesting a loan amount of 20,000 INR (Indian rupees) to buy sewing machines, different colours of threads. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of sewing machines, different colours of threads.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 55 years old and widowed with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Delia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Delia has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is married with six children. She manages a garden plot to sell the produce in the market as an aid to her husband's income. She has been doing this for more than three years and she earns good enough money for their daily needs. She wants to expand her garden by adding another plot of leafy vegetables. She joined GDMPC recently and is able to borrow a loan to purchase organic fertilizer for her vegetable garden. She is hopeful to gain more profit from her little farm to provide the needs of her children in school and wants to provide a comfortable living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase starting inventory of plank, cement, spike and others to start their business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 43 years old and married with four children, all of her children are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

loans.name: Shakerkhan

texts.ru: Шакерхан 61 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Шакерхан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шакерхан занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шакерхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шакерхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шакерхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Shakerkhan is 61 years old, married, and raising four children with her husband.  She has a specialized secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business 25 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Shakerkhan now owns two dairy cows and two horses.  She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her business, Shakerkhan has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.  She plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to perform some repairs in her house.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Petrona Del Socorro

texts.es: Petrona tiene la edad de 51 años, soltera, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes de beisbol desde hace 1 año, los comercializa en el mercado oriental, Rivas y Masatepe. Actualmente tiene a 5 trabajadoras en su taller de costura, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de una maquina industrial para aumentar sus encargo y venta de los uniformes.
texts.en: Petrona, 51, is single with two children in her care.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been making and selling baseball uniforms at the eastern market, Rivas y Masatepe, for a year.  She currently employs five workers at her sewing shop.  The loan she is requesting is to buy an industrial machine so she can increase production and sell more uniforms.

loans.use: To buy an industrial machine to increase production and sales of uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two or three good used computers and a variety of wholesale stationery supplies.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que se encuentra ubicado en la costa en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Hace 5 años iniciaron junto a su esposa un negocio de crianza y venta de animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, tienen clientela fija, José es un emprendedor y tiene la oportunidad de ofrecer sus animales en zonas aledañas a su comunidad, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para ampliar la comprar de dichos animales y poder venderlos a un mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Carlos, 48, lives with his wife and children in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti, a village focused mainly on commerce of small animals and agriculture.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo which is on the coast of the region of Lambayeque in northern Peru.

Five years ago José Carlos and his wife started a business in their backyard raising and selling small animals to a small fixed customer base.  José is an entrepreneur who has the opportunity to sell his animals in the neighboring areas of his community.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy more animals so he can sell them at a better price and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy small animals.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco tiene 61 años de edad, es casado. Es un hombre que desde muy pequeño le ha gustado trabajar y se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, por lo que su nivel de estudio solamente llego hasta el 2° grado; ahora en día su esposa le brinda apoyo en todas las actividades que realizan criando pollos de engorde y cuidando los cultivos. Tienen 2 niñas, una de 9 años que estudia 3° grado y la otra de 11 años que estudia 5°grado, estas dos pequeñas además de estudiar realizan labores en apoyo a sus padres realizando tareas del hogar y ayudando a alimentar los pollos cuando se requiere. 

El cliente se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, desde hace 8 años que decidieron emprender este negocio con su pareja y también dedica parte de su tiempo a cultivar pequeñas parcelas de hortalizas, que le ayudan a solventar algunas necesidades económicas, ya que también comercializa verduras en el mercado. Con la ayuda de su esposa tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad, para adquirir los insumos (pollos y concentrados) para su producción y para obtenerlos tienen que caminar casi 1km de distancia para abordar el medio de transporte que los lleva hasta la ciudad que esta aproximadamente como a 18 km y en el regreso con los materiales (bolsas de harina y cajas con pollos) deben de cargarlos en su espalda hasta llegar a su casa. 

El crédito será destinado para invertirlo en pollos de engorde,: mejora de instalaciones(galeras), compra de concentrado y compra de pie de criá(200). Quiere aprovechar la época navideña, por la demanda de pollos y el buen precio que este producto obtiene en esta epoca. Esto le generara mejores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y también tener recursos suficientes para volver a invertir en próximas producciones. 


Quiere tener diversificadas las formas de obtener ingresos, que le permitan dar un margen de maniobra,  si una de estas no le funcionara, va a tener otras que si; permitiendo le minimizar la perdida en sus inversiones.
texts.en:
Francisco is 61 years old and he is married. Since he was a young child he enjoyed working, specifically in agriculture, and for this reason his highest level of education is the 2nd grade. Nowadays, his wife helps him with all tasks related to their small-scale poultry production, and also with the cultivation of crops. They have two girls, a nine-year-old in 3rd grade, and an eleven-year-old in 5th grade. The girls also help their parents with household chores, and to feed the chickens when needed.

Francisco began raising chickens 8 years ago, when along with his wife they decided to launch this business. Part of his time also goes towards cultivating small plots of vegetables and selling them in the market; this helps him to solve some financial needs.

When he has to buy supplies for his poultry production (chickens and feed) his wife helps him too. First they have to walk about 1 Km to catch the bus that takes them to the city center –which is about 18 Km away-, and then, on the way back home they have to carry the supplies on their backs (sacs full of feed and crates with chickens).

This loan will be an investment to buy chickens and 200 hens, to improve the facilities (the chicken coops), and to buy feed. He wants to take advantage of the holiday season coming up, as the demand for chicken increases, as well as the market price during that season. This would generate greater revenue to cover the general expenses of the family, and he could also earn additional profits to invest in future productions.

Francisco wants to diversify his sources of income, in order to attain some financial leeway, so that in the case that one of these streams of income fails, he may rely on alternative income, minimizing investment loss.

loans.use: to buy chickens and 200 hens, to improve the facilities (the chicken coops), and to buy feed.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la casa de su tía en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se caracteriza por el comercio y agricultura, está ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El es conocido en el medio, por su labor de servicio de transporte público (mototaxi) de Zaña – Cayalti y viceversa, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Armando, 27, lives with his wife in his aunt's home in the urban area of Cayaltí.  The community is known for its commerce and agriculture and is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque along the northern coast of Peru.

He is well-known in the sector for his public transportation (motortaxi) service between Zaña and Cayalti.  He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN to pay for vehicle maintenance so he can offer better customer service.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Elmer Luis

texts.es:
Elmer Luis tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, donde su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que está ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica al servicio de transporte público mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes de Zaña – Cayalti y viceversa, ha tenido inconvenientes con su vehículo debido al mal estado de las carreteras y ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo de esta manera poder seguir brindado este servicio ya que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer Luis, 33, lives with his wife in the urban area of Cayaltí, a village known for its commerce and agriculture.  It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo which is in the region of Lambayeque along the northern coast of Peru.

For three years now, Elmer has been running a public transportation service (motortaxi) between Zaña and Cayalti.  He has had to face inconveniences with his vehicle because of the bad condition of the roads.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN for vehicle maintenance so he can continue providing service and earning a living for his family.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Dionalyn

texts.en: Dionalyn is married with three children. She helps her husband in managing their own coco farm for a living. Aside from farming, she is also engaged in an RTW buying and selling business. Dionalyn has joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to cover the costs of farm weeding maintenance. Dionalyn always finds ways to improve their farm in order to sustain the earning that supports the entire family. In the future, Dionalyn plans to cultivate the farm to improve the harvest.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase new rice seeds for the next crops.

Evelyn has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new rice seeds for the next crops.

loans.name: Erkayim

texts.en:
Erkayim is a student of the American University of Central Asia in the department of Psychology and below is her story:

“I have chosen AUCA as the best place for receiving an excellent higher education. I chose studying at AUCA because here the learning language is English. While studying in high school, I was learning English and French. So, my language skills let me enroll in AUCA, and it will of course help me during my studies at AUCA.
 
"AUCA is one of the best universities in Central Asia and I am sure I will get the right education so that I can contribute to the development of my country in the future. 

"Another feature of AUCA is that it gives all students an opportunity to apply for loans. I am applying for a Kiva loan so that I can cover the cost of my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
María de Lourdes tiene 31 años de edad es soltera, vive en su casa propia en la comunidad de Buenos Aires, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio son un distrito conocido por la venta de chicha una bebida que se procesa a base del maíz y crianza de animales menores, dicha comunidad pertenece a Morropon, que está ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores chivos y cerdos, así mismo trabaja en el fundo Natucultura el cual queda ubicado en el Distrito de La Matanza donde se desempeña en el área de producción de híbridos de maíz, con experiencia en el trabajo es mano de obra calificada.

María Lourdes ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles que lo utilizara en los acabados de su vivienda en construcción, compra de puertas, ventanas, hacer el piso falso y colocar la electricidad permitiéndole tener un lugar agradable donde vivir.
texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is 31 years old. She is single and lives in her own house in the community of Buenos Aires, whose pupoulation makes a living in farming and sales. It is a district which is kiwn for selling chicha, a drink which is made from corn, and raising small animals. This community belongs to Morropon, which is located in the region of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

Maria makes a living raising and selling small animals, like goats and pigs. She also and works in the foundation Natucultura, which is located in the district of La Matanza. Here, she works in the production of maiza hybrids and has work experience in skilled labour.

Maria Lourdes has requested a loan of 2000 PEN which she will use to finish building her house; to buy doors, windows, lay a false floor and do the electrics in order to give her a nice place to live.

loans.use: to finish building her house; to buy doors, windows, lay a false floor and do the electrics.

loans.name: Guinekanda 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   GUINEKANDA 3 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  43 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Dénné   assise en première  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 42.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Guinekanda 3 group are married women with an average age of 43 and, on average, 6 children, who all live in polygamous families in Bandiara, the 5th administrative region of Mali. 90% of the Bandiara region is made up of cliffs and the women's main activity is onion growing and producing shallots and derivative products. The women transport the arable soil to higher ground in order to make boards on which to grow their produce. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities at the end of the rainy season. They are on their second loan from the institution, having properly repaid the first.

Dénné, sitting first on the left in the picture, mainly grows onions. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Bandiara to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 42 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will allow her to support her husband with the family expenditures (children's education, health, food) and to buy small ruminants and poultry. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 39 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, coffee, sugar, milk, etc. to sell in her general store. Janet has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, coffee, sugar, milk, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shahane

texts.en:
Shahane is 26 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. Shahane works very hard to provide for them.

Shahane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Shahane has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future, Shahane would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio de Padua  está en su ciclo número 14° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están en un nivel bajo, es decir deben seguir trabajando para mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sunilda, quien se dedica a la   venta de gallinas,  también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace, ya que es una mujer muy luchadora, que pese a los obstáculos está mejorando su vida y trata de dar lo mejor a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de alimentos para aves y otros que ella necesita para seguir con su cría y venta de gallinas el cual a  ella le ayudara   para  mejorar  su calidad de vida así como la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group San Antonio de Padua is on their 14th loan cycle with the women's commitee, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are working on a program aimed towards eliminating poverty, where they are all on a low level, or in other words, where they all need to continue working in order to improve their lives.

One of the members is Sunilda, who makes a living selling chickens. It's worth mentioning also that she is a hard working woman who, despite obstacles, is improving her life and trying to give the best to her family.

Sunilda is requesting this loan to buy animal feed for poultry and other things she needs to continue breeding and selling chickens. This will help her to improve her quality of life, also well as her family's.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Guinekanda 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   GUINEKANDA 1 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Ogomo dite Aïssa   assise en première  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Guinekanda 1 group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 6 children, who all live in polygamous families in Bandiara, the 5th administrative region of Mali. 90% of the Bandiara region is made up of cliffs and the women's main activity is onion growing and producing shallots and derivative products. The women transport the arable soil to higher ground in order to make the boards on which they will grow their produce. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their gardening activities at the end of the rainy season. They are on their second loan from the institution, having correctly repaid the first.

Ogomo, known as Aïssa, sitting first on the left in the picture, mainly grows onions. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Bandiara to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 45 000 francs by the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to support her husband with the family expenditures (children's education, health, food) and to buy small ruminants and poultry. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Indell 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  INDELL 1 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Mariama Ano   debout  en cinquième   position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Indell 1 group are married women with an average age of 38 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Bandiara, the 5th administrative region of Mali. 90% of the Bandiara region is made up of cliffs and the women's main activity is onion growing and producing shallots and derivative products. The women transport the arable soil to higher ground in order to make the boards on which they will grow their produce. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their gardening activities at the end of this rainy season. They are on their second loan from the institution, having properly repaid the first.

Mariama Ano, standing second from the right in the picture, mainly grows onions. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Bandiara to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 40 000 francs by the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to support her husband with the family expenses (children's education, health, food) and to buy small ruminants and poultry. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en:
Batnasan is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children, who are between the ages of 3 and 21, in a ger, which is a traditional nomadic yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Lhamaa, has been helping her at a grocery store business in a small booth in the local market. Now he wants to start his own business of animal pelt retail and supply to big manufacturers. Batnasan's older two children are university students and her younger two children attend local school and kindergarten, respectively.
 
Batnasan has been working as saleswoman in the local market for years and has a lot of experience. She basically runs the business and, when she is able to afford to open a grocery store of her own, she will be starting her own business. She is now requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase animal pelts and other inventory to let her husband start his own business. She is hardworking, caring and very supportive of her husband.

loans.use: to purchase animal pelts and other inventory to let her husband start his own business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is operating a piggery as an aid to her husband's income from his work as motorcycle driver. She has been raising pigs for more than four years. This business earns good enough for the family. She always finds ways to augment their living. Susan joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to repair and expand her livestock's shelter. She is hopeful to improve her piggery business and save a portion of her returns for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her livestock's shelter.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a live-in partner with two children. Marilyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 13,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional goods like shampoo, sugar, cereals, coffee, canned goods, dried fish, etc. to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like shampoo, sugar, cereals, coffee, canned goods, dried fish, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Batzorig

texts.en:
Batzorig is 31 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a small rental house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife, Shinebayar, helps her husband to run their business of storehouse rental and import of grocery products. His 2 children attend local schools.
 
Batzorig had been working at a local flour mill company until 2011. He then started his own business with his wife of importing food products from the Russian boarder based village and selling them to local retailers. 

Batzorig is planning to renovate and insulate the house he lives in now to stay warm during harsh Mongolian winters. He also is planning to purchase this house in a few years so he thinks it will be a good investment to his housing. He is now requesting 5,500,000 MNT to purchase insulation and construction materials to improve his living conditions and stay warm during harsh and cold Mongolian winters. He is a hardworking, well-organized person.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and construction materials to improve his living conditions and stay warm during harsh and cold Mongolian winters.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 23 years old and married. She has one child. 

Riza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Riza has been raising pigs for three years.

In the future, Riza would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mustiola

texts.en:
Mustiola is 39 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Mustiola works very hard to provide for them.

Mustiola runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store. Mustiola has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, hair conditioner, fabric conditioner and other groceries. 

Mustiola would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ayim

texts.en:
Ayim is a student of the American University of Central  Asia, department of sociology. AUCA has been the university of her dreams for a long time and she feels happy to enroll there. The most diverse and experienced body of professors that are tutoring at AUCA make her more interested in studying at AUCA. Also there are students of different nationalities at AUCA and Ayim feels that this will help her to widen her knowledge about different cultures. 

Ayim worked at one of the social organizations and she received an excellent recommendation from there. She worked as a film director's assistant for a social short film in Bishkek. She helped to organize the filmmaking process and also to allocate budget. The project has been finished successfully with the great help of Ayim. Aside from all of the above, Ayim is a good team player with a very open and engaging personality. 

Ayim hopes to get financial support from AUCA. She is applying for a KIVA loan, so that she can cover her tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for my higher education.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Jose está en su ciclo número 13º  del programa de comité, forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, en el cual vienen trabajando arduamente para poder mejorar sus vidas y sus ingresos.
Una mujer que se destaca es Maria, quien además es la presidenta de este grupo. Ella es costurera, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que sus clientes quedan muy conformes siempre con todo lo que hacen. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y emprendedora. Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus pedidos y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
The San Jose group is in its 13th cycle of the committee program. It is a part of the poverty elimination program. In it, they have been working arduously to improve their lives and income.

One woman who stands out is Maria, who is also the president of the group. She is a seamstress and she says that she has earned a very good clientele. since her customers are very satisfied with everything that is done for them. She is a person who is a fighter and enterprising. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying fabric, thread, rubber and other materials to be able to continue with her orders and improve her economy.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, rubber and other materials.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is a driver by profession and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is the mother of two daughters and is motivated to provide for her family.

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy inventories such as stock of rice, sugar and flour for her general store.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado renacer está formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza y también del comité de mujeres, ellas son muy trabajadoras y tienen un gran deseo de poder seguir trabajado para ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Barciliza, quien tiene una heladería surtida con buena variedad de helados. Cuenta que es en esta época en la que tiene mejores ventas, y es por eso que pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados de variados sabores, para poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group, called Renacer, is a part of the poverty elimination program and also the women's committee. They are very hardworking and really want to be able to keep working to help their families.

One of the members is Barciliza. She has an ice cream store stocked with a good variety of ice cream. She says that this is the time of year when she has the best sales. That is why she is asking for this loan to be able to invest it on buying various flavors of ice cream  in order to keep offering a good selection to her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy various flavors of ice cream to sell.

loans.name: María Doralba

texts.es: María, a sus 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos de 10 y 11 años. Se desempeña como comerciante independiente manejando su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que montó en la sala de su casa. La idea surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, pues estaban pasando por una difícil situación financiera. Aprovechó la oportunidad de tener una escuela aledaña a su casa y comenzó vendiendo mecato para los estudiantes, poco a poco la demanda de sus clientes fue aumentando y el negocio se convirtió en lo que es hoy en día, una gran tienda de abarrotes bien surtida; allí trabaja con su esposo y juntos han podido superar todos los obstáculos y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su pujanza y la fortaleza que recibe de su familia, la motivan para solicitar el apoyo del sexto ciclo de crédito, con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, cárnicos, mecato, gaseosas, granos, entre otros) y realizar mejoras locativas (pintar el local), esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del establecimiento y cambiar positivamente la percepción de los transeúntes, que pueden convertirse en clientes potenciales, además, tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para la venta, lo que le ayudará a mejorar las utilidades y los ingresos que recibe para continuar solventando las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Su único desafío, según María, es que el sector donde reside está muy alejado de la cabecera municipal por lo que algunas veces se queda sin surtido debido a la demora en las entregas de los proveedores; sin embargo, esto no la detiene para seguir luchando con amor y dedicación. Ella sueña con acreditar bien su negocio y convertirlo en un minimercado, en el que las personas puedan satisfacer todos los requerimientos y gustos y, así, abrir la posibilidad de brindar a sus hijos una excelente educación tanto secundaria como universitaria para que se conviertan en personas íntegras y puedan disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of two children, aged 10 and 11 years old. She works as an independent merchant, running her own business. It is a general store she set up in the living room of her house. She got the idea out of necessity of generating income to support her family. They were going through a hard time financially. She took advantage of the fact that there was a primary school close to her house and she started selling pastries to the students. Little by little, her clientele grew and the business became what it is today, a great, well stocked general store. She works there with her husband and together they have been able to overcome all of the obstacles and get their children ahead. She gets her drive and her strength from her family. They have motivated her to ask for the help of the sixth credit cycle. With it, she hopes to buy merchandise wholesale (dairy products, meat products, pastries, sodas, grains and more). She will also do some improvements on her locale (painting the locale). This will allow her to improve the image of the establishment and positively change the the perception of the passers-by so that they can become potential customers. In addition, she will have more variety of products available to sell. This will help improve profits and income that she gets to continue paying for her household's basic needs.  Her only challenge, according to María, is that the area where she lives is very distant from headquarters and sometimes she runs out of stock because the deliveries are late from the suppliers. Nonetheless, this doesn't stop her from continuing to fight with love and dedication. She dreams of the possibility of having a good business and turning it into a mini-supermarket where people can fill all of their needs and tastes. This will open the possibility of offering her children an excellent both in high school and college so that they can become upright people and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (dairy products, meat products, pastries, sodas, grains and more) and to make improvements on the locale (painting the locale).

loans.name: Jose Neptali

texts.es: José, tiene 31 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Trinidad, Santa Bárbara. Hace 2 años que se dedica a la elaboración de calzado (zapato juvenil, zapato para niño, botines para caballero, tenis, sandalias etc.). Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en una zapatería donde adquirió mucha experiencia. EL préstamo que solicita es por 11,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de calzado como cuero,suela.plantillas, hilos,pegamento, y otros insumos para  poder incrementar más la producción  y obtener mejores ganancias y ventas. Su meta es que su taller de zapatería crezca, poder ser una persona superada y lograr que su familia viva en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: José is 31 years old.  He is married, has two children and lives in the municipality of Trinidad, in Santa Bárbara.  For two years José has been making a living producing footwear (such as shoes for children and young people, men's boots, trainers, and sandals).  José learned this trade in a cobbler's shop where he gained a lot of experience.  José is applying for a loan of 11,000 Lempira and he will invest it in buying materials for producing footwear.  These materials include leather, soles, inner soles, glue, thread, and other supplies.  With this he can increase production and earn higher profits and more sales.  José's goal is for his workshop to expand, to do better, and to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as leather, soles, inner soles, glue, thread, and more, in order to make footwear.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene siete hijos, vive en unión libre con su esposo y reside en el en municipio de Victoria Yoro. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la caficultura, en la siembra y cultivo de café. Ha solicitado un préstamo  por 10,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de abono y para la limpieza de la finca de café. Este préstamo le ayudara en mejorar la calidad del producto y  obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta es poder llegar a ser una gran productora de café y así poder mejorar económicamente. Y que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en: Juana is 42 years old and has seven children.  She is lives with her partner in the municipality of Victoria Yoro.  For six years Juana has made a living planting and growing coffee.  She is applying for a loan of 10,000 Lempira which she will invest in buying manure and in cleaning the coffee plantation.  This loan will help Juana to improve the quality of her products and to earn higher profits.  Her goal is become a big coffee producer and so improve her financial situation.  Her other aim to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy manure and to clean her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jaider Alonso

texts.es: Jaider es un campesino de 34 años de edad, nació en el seno de una familia humilde campesina, en la que aprendió todo lo relacionado con la agricultura y el cuidado de los animales, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de ñame, yuca y maíz, ubicados en su propia finca, allí recolecta las cosechas y las comercializa en el mercado de la región; adicionalmente alterna su labor como independiente trabajando diariamente como jornalero, de esta manera, genera los recursos económicos suficientes para brindar el sustento a su único hijo y solventar las necesidades básicas de la casa, ya que toda la carga económica recayó sobre él, tras la separación con su esposa. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre pujante, perseverante y sagaz, siempre está buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el que comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, venenos, fertilizantes, fungicidas) y pagar la limpieza de la cosecha de yuca, esto le permitirá mejorar notablemente sus cultivos y podrá tener una cosecha más productiva, generando mejores ingresos para la economía del país. Jaider solo desea seguir trabajando arduamente para lograr que su negocio sea más rentable y tener la capacidad para brindar a su hijo una mejor educación, bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jaider is a 34-year-old peasant and was born into the heart of a humble country family.  Within the family he learned everything about agriculture and looking after animals.  Thanks to this Jaider now has yam, yucca and corn crops on his own farm.  There he brings in the harvest and sells it at the regional market.  In addition to this work, Jaider also works every day as a labourer and, through this, earns enough money to support his only son and pay for basic necessities in the home.  Following a separation from his wife, Jaider is responsible for all financial burdens.  Jaider is persevering, shrewd  and strong.  He is always looking for alternative ways in which to prosper and so is applying for a loan with which to buy farming supplies (manure, poisons, fertilisers, and fungicides) in bulk, and to pay to clean the yucca harvest.  This will allow Jaider to improve his crops notably and he will be able to have a bigger yield at harvest, generating and higher income for the country's economy.  Jaider only wants to continue working hard in order for his business to become more profitable and so that he is able to provide his son with a better upbringing, better well-being, and a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, poisons, fertilisers, and fungicides) in bulk, and to pay to clean the yucca harvest.

loans.name: José

texts.pt:
José é segurança numa empresa privada, tem 40 anos de idade  é casado e tem 4 filhos com 21, 16, 13, 2 anos os dois do meio estão a estudar no nível secundário e primário, vive na casa própria sustenta a mãe e 1 sobrinha.
Com o valor do credito  ira comprar chapas de zinco, barrotes, pregos, cimento para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Para o futuro diz que quer fazer carta de condução, ampliar sua casa e fazer uma barraca para ajudar com as receitas na renda familiar. 
Diz que ira pagar pontualmente as prestacoes e voltar a solicitar mais emprestimos para a realizacao de seus planos.
texts.en:
José is a security guard for a private company. He's 40 years old and married. He has four children aged 21, 16, 13 and 2 years, and the two middle children attend secondary and primary school. He lives in a house that he owns and supports his mother and a niece.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase metal sheets, beams, nails and cement in order to continue his construction work.
He states that in the future he wishes to get his driver's license, enlarge his house and set up a sales booth so he can contribute the profits to his family's income.
He states that he'll make the repayments in a timely fashion and request more loans again so he can accomplish his plans.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, beams, nails and cement.

loans.name: Raivoso

texts.pt:
Raivoso, casado, pai de 6 (seis) filhos, dos quais 04 (quatro) é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua sobrinha que vive com ele. 
É Oficial Principal de Segurança na Açucareira de Xinavane. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir material de construção (sacos de cimento, barrotes, areia fina e grossa) a fim de efectuar obras de reabilitação na sua casa.
Tem como sonhos construir um aviário, criar uma oficina de serralharia e melhorar as condições da sua moradia. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir.
texts.en:
Raivoso is married and has six children, four of whom attend different levels of school. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family, he also support his niece who lives with him.
He's a senior security officer for the Xinavane sugar company.
With the current loan for 20,000mt he intends to purchase construction supplies (bags of cement, beams, fine and coarse sand) so he can do restoration work on his house.
His dreams are to build an aviary, set up a locksmith shop and improve the condition of his home. His main challenge is the lack of funds for investing.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bags of cement, beams, fine and coarse sand) so he can do restoration work on his house.

loans.name: Jesus Salvador

texts.es: Jesús es un señor de 53 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre ejemplar de 3 hijos. Su oficio es Pintor, dedicado con tanto esmero a la pintura de automóviles, el cual lo inicio hace 25 años con mucho empeño y capital propio. Sus hijos y sus trabajadores lo apoyan con el negocio. Su meta próxima es ayudar a su hija en sus estudios universitarios para que sea una profesional exitosa. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales como: lubricantes , pintura,cemento, ventanas, entre otros, con el fin de mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y de su taller. Estima que con el crédito tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, y podrá asegurarle un buen hogar a su familia. Su plan futuro es seguir trabajando para tener altos ingresos.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 53-year-old man from the city of Boaco. He is married and is an exemplary father of three children. He works as a painter and works hard painting cars. He started this business 25 years ago, with his effort and own capital. His children and his employees support him. His short term goal is to help his daughter with her university studies, so that she can become a successful professional.

Jesús is requesting a loan to buy materials such as lubricants, paint, cement and window frames in order to make some improvements to his house and his workshop. With this loan, he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life and make sure their home is in good conditions. His future plans are to continue working to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy materials such as lubricants, paint, cement and window frames.

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan is 37 years old, and lives with her husband and 4 children under age 16 in a Ger (a traditional nomadic tent) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Batmunh has been involved in a traditional boot manufacturing business since 2005. Her 3 older children attend local public schools and the youngest son goes to a local kindergarten.
 
Bayasgalan has been helping her husband with his traditional shoe manufacturing business since 2005 at home. They have been pleasing their clients with their quality and inexpensive shoes for years and have expanded the business and employed 3 people and taught them the whole shoe process. They are hardworking, kind, and helpful people who are now starting to manufacture winter boots and have employed 2 more striving individuals to provide cobbler services in their business and have taught them about the new product line. She is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory for the new product line of winter boots.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts inventory to manufacture their new product line of winter boots

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elisa is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetable, spices, etc., for her restaurant business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetable, spices, etc

loans.name: Batzul

texts.en:
Mr. Batzul is 23 years old and lives with his mother and sibling in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His mother runs a small business by herself and his sibling is a university student. 

Batzul has been working as a driver of an inter-city mini bus since 2010. He is very talented, a good driver and started working at a local driving school part time in 2012. He is planning to provide a taxi service business in town and is now requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a car of his own and to start his taxi service business. He also is planning to rent his car to a driving school he works part time for while he teaches the classes and increases his income. 

He is a hardworking, responsible and consistent person.

loans.use: to purchase a car of his own and start his taxi service business.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in a small house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son is 9 years old and attends a local primary school. 

Byambasuren has been working as a hairdresser since 2003 in a local barbershop. He is very talented and well-known within the town. He is now planning to increase his sales and provide a variety of services and needs extra inventory for it. He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase inventory including shampoos, conditioners, masks, hair colors and other inventory in large amounts to please his clients.

loans.use: to purchase shampoos, conditioners, masks, hair colors, and other inventoy in large amounts to please his clients

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 50 years old, married, and has four children.

Teofila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Teofila has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from renting gowns.

Teofila aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Oudomphaktra

texts.en:
Oudomphaktra was born in a family farm in Takeo province. His parents are junior high school teachers and also farmers. This year Oudomphaktra just freshly graduated from high school in his hometown province. Oudomphaktra wants to continue studying at a nursing college in Phnom Penh. He is interested in the midwifery subject and wants to specialized in this. Due to the high cost of education, Oudomphaktra decided to request a loan from HKL, a reliable MFI that provides a long-term grace period on principal. His first academic course costs 1,000 US dollars. 

Oudomphaktra is committed to studying hard with the loan funded because he realizes that an education will give him the opportunity to get a high-paying job that will allow him to support his parents when they get older. Though he is the borrower of the loan, his parents, who are not included in the picture, will be responsible for the principal repayments, so during his studies he plans to find part-time work in order to help his parents repay the loan.

Oudomphaktra appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to programs like Kiva via its partners HKL which have supported his education as well as other students.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees at the university.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Pelagia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Pelagia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Florivic

texts.en:
Florivic is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming calamansi [a citrus fruit] in the Philippines. Florivic is borrowing 16,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Florivic has been farming calamansi for seven years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
Nanet is 44 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nanet is borrowing 16,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nanet has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from nipa roofing making [weaving palm fronds].

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 48 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 12,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, spices, etc., for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, spices, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Bauerjan

texts.en:
Mr. Bauerjan is 38 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife Mariya works at a local cafeteria as an assistant chef, and his son Medeu attends the local primary school. 

Bauerjan has been providing a small billiard center in a rental space for nine years and recently started a taxi service business in town. He has purchased a secondhand car for his business and is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to repair and maintain his car and continue providing his taxi service. 

He is a hardworking, welcoming and friendly man.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his car and continue providing his taxi service.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. She operates a farm where she grows crops for sale. 

She describes her family challenge to be that they don’t have a good house. She will use the 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy iron sheets for roofing their house. This will enable them to harvest rain water during the rainy season. She hopes that in the future, she will have a descent house. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support her family. Lina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Lina has been in this business for nine years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.en:
Tiburcia is 59 years old and has six children. Tiburcia is widowed and has one child who is still in school.

Tiburcia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Tiburcia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tiburcia has been in the pig fattening business for 13 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Tiburcia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 39-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four daughters and a son. 
Her husband is a turner by profession, he works using a lathe machine; he manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, and renews the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and his business has been very stable. Due to continuously working the lathe machine some of the important parts have deteriorated and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of affected parts it will highly affect the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.
Her husband is a poor person and does not have a sufficient amount to buy spare parts to fix the problem of the lathe machine and buy cutting tools. 
Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy spare parts and cutting tools for his lathe machine. 
Razia hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and cutting tools for her husband's lathe machine.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman. She has four children.She describes herself as honest and daring. She does farming to earn a living. She describes her biggest business challenge to be access to water. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a 2300 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy and well brought up family. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 150,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 2300 litre water tank

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a student of the American University of Central Asia, Department of Anthropology and here is her story.
“It was my dream to enroll at AUCA, Department of Anthropology from the time that I studied at high school. As everybody knows, this university is one of the best universities in the whole of Central Asia and prepares skilled specialists. Last year I was a student of the preparatory course and now I know the rules of the university and how the system works here. 
Anthropology is about human thinking, activity and communication in its social, economic, ecological, biological, cultural, historical, political and psychological areas. It is one of the most wide-ranging academic disciplines. I think my educational background will help me to be one of the top students at AUCA. 
AUCA gives all the opportunities for studies and also it gives financial support to all its students. I would like to take the opportunity to apply for a KIVA loan, which will help me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 31 years old and married. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a business of stitching and selling embroidery dresses by machine in a nearby town, which he has been doing for many years. He has been recruiting workers for embroidery work on daily wages. He also brings material home for Najma because she helps him with embroidery work. He is an expert in his profession and is especially famous for bridal dresses. 

During the wedding season, there is a large demand for his work. Najma is requesting a loan from BRAC, which she will use  to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors so that he husband can meet the demand for bridal dresses.

loans.use: to purchase cloths, sequins, pearls, and threads of various colors

loans.name: Sharen Erika

texts.en:
Becoming a doctor is Sharen's dream. Sharen is currently attending the Universidad Nuestra Senora de La Paz, working towards her degree in medicine. She plans on graduating in July, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Sharen plans on using the loan to pay for her tuition. With a degree in medicine she expects to earn $20 a day. As the youngest in her family, with one older sibling attending college already, Sharen is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs.

loans.name: Amaly

texts.en:
Becoming a lawyer has always been Amaly's dream. To achieve her goal, Amaly has enrolled in the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier. She expects to graduate in December, 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Amaly says that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a loan, Amaly plans on using the funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Chuquisaca. With a career in law, she expects to earn $34 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Amaly is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Adela Betha

texts.en:
Adela dreams of becoming an engineer and is especially interested in mining. Adela was accepted into the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Adela plans on spending the money on purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Adela hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. Adela currently works 30 hours a week to help afford her school and living expenses. Making the time to work and go to school has been one of her biggest challenges.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Agossi

texts.en:
Eleven years ago, Agossi left her home in Togo to move to New York with the dream of owning her own business.  Although she had experience selling jewelry in her home country, she faced many obstacles trying to start her own business in the United States.  

Agossi worked hard to overcome these challenges, even taking classes to earn an entrepreneurship certificate at Lehman College. Four years ago she was finally able to open Sedak #1, a wholesale jewelry business. Currently, Agossi buys jewelry from China and sells it to several retailers throughout the state. She would love to start importing from other regions of the world, especially her homeland of North Africa. She believes there would be a significant market in New York for this traditional style of jewelry, but lacks the capital to make the initial investment.

With your help, Agossi would be able to purchase more jewelry and expand the designs that she can offer.  Help Agossi expand her business and share her culture with the women who purchase her jewelery!

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the rent for her dance school

loans.name: Clemencia Janeth

texts.en:
Clemencia dreams of becoming a commercial engineer. Clemencia is currently attending UDABOL, working towards her degree in commercial engineering. She expects to graduate in March, 2014, but without a loan, she is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. 

Clemencia says that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Clemencia plans on using the funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Cochabamba. 

One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in commercial engineering, she expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Growing up, finances were always tight. Unfortunately, Clemencia's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. With one older sibling attending college already, Clemencia is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. To help afford her school and living expenses, Clemencia currently works 30 hours a week.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Estefania Rosario

texts.en:
Becoming a psychologist is Estefania's dream. Estefania was accepted into the Universidad La Salle and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in June, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Estefania plans on using the loan to pay for her tuition. To help afford her school and living expenses, Estefania currently works 40 hours a week as a travel agent and earns $9 a day.

loans.use: to pay tuition costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more house-cleaning equipment.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela dreams of becoming a lawyer. Maricela was accepted into the Universidad San Francisco de Asís and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in March, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Maricela plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in law before graduating. With a career in law, she expects to earn more than before. Maricela hopes to be a role model for her younger sibling by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 Rs [Pakistani rupees], which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Juu Kwa Juu Group

texts.en:
Victor, who is married with four children who are in school, has been running a stationery business since 2002. Victor, who was born in the late 1960s, is working hard to see his business success. He starts working from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to buy missing stationery products so as to meet his client demand. He has paid back the entire loan successfully. With the business profit, he finished building his house and covered school fees and home expenses. Victor will use this loan to replenish more items in his business. He dreams to buy a transportation bus.

Victor will share this loan with his loan group, JUU KWA JUU, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more items in his stationery business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo came to the United States from Cuba in 1988. After spending years learning the trade, in 1995 he became the proud owner of Atlantic Dry Cleaners, a reputable dry cleaning business. 

Eduardo's company has even had a military contract. He says, "To be a part of the government contractors serving the military bases such as the Homestead Air Force Base and United States Southern Command has been the greatest opportunity that I've had in running my business so far." 

His company currently has three employees, including his wife and they have been able to build solid clientele over the years. 

Unfortunately, a few years ago Eduardo was the victim of identity theft, which badly damaged his credit. His business is at the point where he needs to renovate and purchase new machines. Because of his credit situation, he has been unable to obtain the necessary loans to buy the equipment he needs to keep his business competitive.

Help Eduardo maintain his business of 18 years and continue to thrive with a loan!

loans.use: To renovate his machines and equipment.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
A few years ago, Karen and her husband went through a rough patch while her husband struggled to find a job in the rural town in Indiana where they reside. She was very proud when he finally got a job as a trucker.  Wanting to be more involved, Karen helped her husband as much as she could from dispatching to organizing his routes. 

Karen herself is on disability Social Security, but she would like to be able to generate enough income to fully support herself. Seeing the need her husband had for extra help and an opportunity to use her experience, she decided to open her own business.  Her business will move freight with semi-trucks all over America.  In order to successfully launch her business though, there are many initial fees that Karen simply cannot afford on her own.  

With your help, Karen will be able to pay for the necessary training, fees, and supplies. Please help Karen get her new business off the ground!

loans.use: Training, fees, and supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 48. She is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow and she has five children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Zenaida operates a meat stall. She buys meat from suppliers who deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are chicken, pork and meat. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of the products' freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of chicken and pork meat needed in her business. 

Zenaida dreams to expand her business and hopes that her family will always stick together. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies of chicken and pork meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 44 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Susan has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a 13,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Susan has been in this business for two years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 46-year-old married woman. She is running a business selling animals with her husband, who is also shown in the picture. They have one buffalo, one cow, two goats and one calf.
