She looks after the cattle while her husband sells them in local market. They are happily doing it together to support their family. They have seven children; only three of them are school-going due to their financial conditions. 

They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, Zubaida requested a loan of 35,000 PKR [Pakistan rupees] to buy two more calves. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her second loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy two more calves.

loans.name: Tatiana Fernanda

texts.en:
Tatiana dreams of becoming an architect, but she knows that without a degree, it may never be possible. To achieve her goal, Tatiana has enrolled in the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Tatiana plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in architecture before graduating. With a degree in architecture she expects to earn $30 a day. Tatiana hopes to be a role model for her three younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university. To help afford her school and living expenses, Tatiana currently works 40 hours a week as a quality control inspector and earns $17 a day.

loans.use: to help afford graduation fees.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru: Исмоилчону 46 лет. Он маляр из Худжанда. Его работа заключается в том, чтобы добавить яркие краски на серых и тусклых стенах. Яркие и приятные цвета в нашем интерьере поднимают нам настроение, улучшают жизнь и повышают уровень миролюбивости. Из этого вывод такой, что работа Исмоилчона это дарить радость окружающим. Чтобы дальше развиваться в этой области деятельности Исмоилчон хочет купить новые кисти и краски. Чтобы их купить у него не хватает средств. Поэтому он просит помощи с вашей стороны. У Исмоилчона попортились кисти и закончились краски, он остро нуждается в новых. Он любит свою работу и не хочет расставаться с ней. В такой сфере деятельности Исмоилчон работает более 10 лет. Для него работа очень важна. Его работа не только любимое занятие, но и средство дохода в его семью. Он должен обеспечить свою семью - жену, сына и дочь. Исмоилчон надеется на Вашу помощь!
texts.en:
Ismoiljon is 46 years old. He is a painter from Khujand. His work is to add bright colors to grey and dull walls. Bright and pleasant colors in our interior cheer us up, improve life and make us peaceful. From this, the conclusion is that Ismoiljon's work gives joy to his surroundings. 

In order to further develop this area of business, Ismoiljon would like to purchase new brushes and paint. He does not have enough money to purchase them. Therefore he requests help from you. Ismoiljon has used up his brushes and finished the paint, so he acutely needs new ones. He loves his work and would not like to separate from it. 

Ismoiljon has worked in this area of business for more than 10 years. To him, his work is very important. His work is not only his beloved activity, but also a mean of income for his family. He needs to support his family: His wife, son and daughter. Ismoiljon needs your help!

loans.use: to purchase brushes and paint

loans.name: Satyaperkas

texts.en:
Mr. Satyaperkas is 36 years old and has a family with two school-aged children. 

Satyaperkas was previously working in the company of his father. With the support of Seva MFI, he started planting independently on leased land and repaid his loan on time. 

Satyaperkas wants to save for his own plot through his rice cultivation. He has approached Seva MFI for a new loan of SRD 10,000 to finance his operating costs: diesel fuel, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.use: Tohelp pay his farm's operating costs: diesel fuel, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en:
Farah is 34 years old, married, and has children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. By bicycle, her husband sells hair oils, such as avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, and safflower oil. He is known for having hair oils that protect hair from falling out. 

Farah is requesting her second loan from BRAC; which she will use to purchase hair oils for her husband. With the loan, she hopes her husband will be able to expand his business and overcome the family's poverty.

loans.use: to purchase hair oils

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, who is a resident of Batasan, Quezon CIty, Philippines. She is married, and she has children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses.  

Zenaida operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for only one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings.

Zenaida hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of ther work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en:
For Jannette, photography is more than just job, it’s a calling. Jannette earned her degree in visual arts and photography from Florida International University. She also volunteers her free time working on the production of a cancer documentary, “The Will to Live.”

In 2009 she opened her own business, Art Life Studios and began operations in 2011. Her business provides several services including photography, editing, products and design. Her photography focuses on families, couples, children, portraits, and special events. 

Unfortunately, Jannette has been struggling to compete in the market because some of her equipment is outdated. With your support, Jannette will be able to upgrade some of her equipment so that she can better serve her clients. She would also like to continue building upon her cancer photography collection, and someday hopes to open a small studio space to exhibit these documentaries. Help Jannette pursue her passion and spread awareness about this important issue!

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for her photography business.

loans.name: Astrie

texts.en: Astrie is a single mother with three children. After the death of her husband, she started to do rice cultivation with her son. Meanwhile, she expanded her farming area with the support from Seva MFI. Astrie has two school-aged daughters. She wants to save for them so that she can afford to send them to high school. Rice cultivation is her only source of income. Astrie fully repaid her entire previous loan from Seva MFI on time. With the new loan of SRD 10.000 she will purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Indell 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  INDELL 3 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  45 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Assatou  debout en quatrième  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 42.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "INDELL 3" are all married women, who average 45 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution after having paid back the first one.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Assatou, who is standing fourth from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 42,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food) and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Soedesh

texts.en: Soedesh is 42 years old and has a family with two children. He is a rice grower and is planting on 12 hectares of private and leased plots. With the support of Seva MFI he bought a dumping pickup; this is providing the family extra income. Soedesh has repaid his loan fully and applied for a new loan of 7,000 SRD to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation. His goal is to save for his future and send his children to high school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation

loans.name: Narinder

texts.en:
Narinder is a single man of 44 years, and has a son and a daughter. He has lost his father at an early age. He is not educated, and has been doing rice cultivation since the age of 15. 

Narinder wants to give his children a proper education so that they can have a good future. Rice cultivation is his only source of income. He took several loans from Seva MFI and repaid them fully on time. Narinder applied for a new loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nazier

texts.en:
Nazier is 46 years old and has a family with three school going children. Nazir has been doing rice cultivation since an early age. With the support of Seva MFI, he expanded his rice areas to 12 hectares. With the extra income, he renovated his house and paid for study costs for his children. 

Nazir and his wife are saving for future costs when their children enter higher education. Nazir repaid his entire previous loan from Seva MFI fully, and needs another loan of SRD 7,000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizers for his rice cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Amriet

texts.en: Amriet is 47 years old and lives with his wife. Besides doing rice cultivation, he breeds sheep and goats. He was formerly financing his input with his paddy buyer who was charging high interest rates and offered low prices. In 2012 he had his first loan from Seva MFI and repaid that fully. Amriet can now save more. He is looking to increase production and save enough to renovate his house. He is asking Seva MFI to finance the operating costs of his rice cultivation and for that he needs a loan of SRD 10,000.

loans.use: To finance the operating costs of his rice production, such as diesel, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Soedirman

texts.en:
Soedirman is 46 years old and has a family with two children. Since an early age, he does rice cultivation, while his wife works as a waitress in a restaurant. Soedirman is planting rice on rented plots. Since 2006, he is doing business with Seva MFI, and has been able to buy a tractor. 

He wants to expand his rice areas, and therefore needs a loan of SRD 7,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. His goal is to save enough to buy his own plots.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Pertaap

texts.en:
Pertaap has grown rice since he was very young. He is 56 years old and lives with his wife, two children, a daughter-in-law and a grandchild. The family’s only source of income comes from their rice.

Pertaap was formerly financing his farming through his paddy middleman who was charging high interest rates and offering low prices on Pertaap’s crops. Since the arrival of Seva MFI he is no longer dependent on his buyer and can save more money.

Pertaap wants his married son to follow in his footsteps and become a good farmer. Therefore he needs to plant rice on a larger scale and is applying for an 8000 SRD loan through Seva MFI to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Badreya

texts.en: Badreya was born in 1977.  She is divorced and lives at a sector in Jordan called Marka. Badreya started selling food products at her house 4 years ago. She started her project with selling a small quantity of food products trying to support herself financially after her divorce. Now she is planning to expand her project and would like to buy a larger quantity of cold drinks, candy and other products to raise her sales and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of cold drinks, candy and other food products.

loans.name: Guinekanda 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   GUINEKANDA 2  sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Salimata  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 42.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "GUINEKANDA 2" are all married women, who average 39 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. 

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution after having correctly paid back the first one.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Salimata, who is standing third from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 42,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 36 years old and married. 

She has been doing a business of bangles sales for the past seven years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband is an employee in the education department, and his income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income. 

Asia has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. 

She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Indell 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   INDELL  2 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec  Hawa   debout en troisième  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 41.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "INDELL 2" are all married women, who average 36 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their second loan with the institution after having correctly paid back the first one.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Hawa, who is standing third from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 41,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants, and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is 38 years old and married. She has run a business selling cloths for many years with the support of her husband. 

She buys a variety of cloths from the main city at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Suraya has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Ghulam Sakina

texts.en:
Ghulam Sakina is 53 years old and married, the mother of two children. She has been running a business of animal puchases and sales for many years. 

She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

Currently she has requested for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase two more calves and a baby goat. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves and a baby goat.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.fr: Valerie est une femme de 38 ans, mère de famille.Elle gère un bar-restaurant dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 04 ans déjà où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques et de la nourriture.Elle a acquise au fil du temps une expérience dans le domaine ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable. Malheureusement,la petitesse de son stock ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement la demande de sa clientèle ce qui crée par conséquent une diminution importante de celle-ci ce qui entraîne de ce fait la baisse de ses ventes et donc de ses bénéfices. Elle sollicite à nouveau ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons et aussi les chaises pour agrandir sa structure. ce qui lui permettra de retenir et gagner la clientèle mais plus précisément d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. benefice qui lui permettra d'une part d'agrandir et d’aménager sa structure et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Valerie is a 38-year-old woman and the mother of a family. She has been running a bar-restaurant in a district in the capital for four years already. There, she sells hygienic beverages and food. She has acquired experience in this domain over the course of time, and this has enabled her to earn a considerable customer base. Unfortunately, her meager inventory prevents her from satisfying the customer demand appropriately. Thus, her customer base has shrunk significantly resulting in a drop in sales and therefore  in her profits, too. 

She is requesting this new loan to be able to purchase more cases of beverages and also some chairs to expand her business.This will enable her to retain customer and earn more, but to be more exact, to increase her sales and her profits as well. The profits will allow her in part to expand her business and to renovate it, as well as to meet family needs.

loans.use: to build up her stock of beverages and buy chairs.

loans.name: Kitungu Group

texts.en:
Mustafa, who is in his mid-30s, is married with two children, one son and one daughter.  Both are going to school.  

He has been running two types of businesses.  One is buying shoes to sell and repairing shoes.  He has also been selling charcoal for a year and a half now.  He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mustafa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to start selling charcoal, and he also bought more shoes to resell and repaired more shoes because he had managed to get better shoe repair.  

He is really happy with the loan because now he is leaving a happy life.  He used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses, and he also bought a plot of land.  

He will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, more equipment for shoe repair, and more shoes to resell. He dreams of expanding his business.

Mustafa will share this loan with his loan group "KITUNGU," which has three members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal, more equipment for shoe repair, and more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Turibamwe Group

texts.fr:
Christophe  fait partie du groupe  Turibamwe  et  habite à Cibitoke. Il a 41 ans et marié à Jeanne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans  dont 4 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des habits   depuis 3 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits (300 pièces)   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait construire, une belle maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Christophe is part of the group Turibamwe and lives in Cibitoke. He is married to Jeanne, a farmer. Together they have six children, from 1 to 14 years old, of whom four are students. 

Christophe has been doing commerce in clothing for three years. 

He is on his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many pieces of clothing (300 pieces) to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to build a nice house and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many pieces of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: María Ismelda

texts.es:
María de 41 años, estudio noveno grado, es casada,  tiene 5 hijos todos viven con ella y su esposo.
Ella solo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, quien trabaja para el sustento de la familia es el esposo (en albañilería y de seguridad por las noches), y uno de sus hijos (en la agricultura)

El crédito lo necesita para pagar dos créditos que posee, el primero porque les aumentaron la tasa de interés y el segundo para que le disminuya la cuota, pues solo manejara uno,. Cuando adquirió el segundo crédito era para mejorar la casa, pero en ese momento, tuvo un accidente uno de sus hijos y falleció. Por lo que el dinero, lo utilizaron en los gastos fúnebres, y se vieron en la necesidad de sacar otro crédito, en otra institución para terminar lo de la casa.

A futuro piensa que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old. She studied until ninth grade. She is married and has 5 children who live with her and her husband.  She tends to the housework. The family members who work to provide for the family are her husband (in masonry and security at night), and one of her sons (in agriculture). 

She needs the loan repay two loans that she has taken. She took the first loan because interests rates increased and the second to reduce the installments, so that there would only be one. When she acquired the second loan, it was supposed to be used to improve the home, but at that time, one of her children had an accident and died. So the money was used to pay for funeral expenses. They then had to take out another loan from another institution to complete the house. 

She hopes that in the future her children become professionals.

loans.use: to pay two loans that she has taken.

loans.name: Indell 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  INDELL 7 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur  1er prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Hawa   assise en deuxième  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 23.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "INDELL 7" are all married women, who average 30 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. 

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their first loan with the institution.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Hawa, who is sitting second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 23,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Indell 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   INDELL 6 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  46 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Djènèba Kandia   debout en première  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "INDELL 6" are all married women, who average 46 years of age and seven children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Bandiagara as a town is 90% cliffs. There, the women's main work involves growing onions and processing shallots and related products. The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work. 

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy season ends. They are on their first loan with the institution.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Djènèba Kandia, who is standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 20,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. She has been in this business for five years now and it continues to grow. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. The income from her business assisted in their everyday household expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Hazel hopes that her business will be more successful and dreams of having a happy family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Adela works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Adela is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Adela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a young man who was born in the Machakos district in Kenya but moved to the capitol city, Nairobi, in search of employment. Due to the hardships he encountered while trying to get a job, he developed the desire to start, manage and run his own business. He identified a need for sanitation in the Mukuru informal settlement, and decided to start a Fresh Life toilet franchise. 

Stanley therefore seeks money to fund the purchase of two Fresh Life toilets, which he will use as his source of income. He hopes that his franchise will grow in the future and create more employment opportunities for the other youth in his area. He is happy that this investment will help ease the sanitation issues in the area. He also hopes that his success will inspire other youth to start their own ventures instead of relying on limited employment opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra was born in 1978. She is married and a mother of 2. Her husband is a freelancer, working alone. Yusra has been working at her mini market for a long time. She started her project with selling a small quantity of food products at her house. Then she opened her own mini market. She is trying to support her husband and children financially. 

Now she is planning to expand her project and would like to increase the merchandise in her mini market by buying a larger quantity of food products, juice, and candy to raise her sales and income. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of food products, juice, and candy.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a retail shop where he sells sandals, sugar, milk, bread, soap and other items. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate water supply. He will use the KES 67,040 loan to buy a 10,000 litre water tank. He will be able to store water for selling to different customers. He hopes that in the future, he will have a borehole. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 10,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Pedro Nel

texts.es: Pedro, con 52 años de edad, es casado y padre de 5 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como vigilante en diferentes unidades residenciales, pero con el fin de aprovechar una oportunidad de independizarse, decidió retirarse de su empleo y, con el dinero de la liquidación y algunos ahorros compró una tienda de abarrotes que era propiedad de su padre quien ya entrado en una edad avanzada decidió devolverse para su pueblo natal a pasar sus últimos años de vida. Trabaja todos los días de la semana de 8:00 am a 10:00 pm para aprovechar al máximo las ventajas que posee de estar muy bien ubicado, que sus vecinos generalmente consumen a diario sus productos y la trayectoria que tiene en el mercado, pues ya es de su propiedad hace 19 años. El cliente es un hombre carismático, pujante y dedicado a su familia y a su labor, siempre busca nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante y por ello se motiva a solicitar el crédito, con el que pretende arreglar el motor de un enfriador y comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, cárnicos, huevos, granos, pastas, gaseosas, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de su activos y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en sus ventas y en los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Pedro desea seguir trabajando arduamente para mantener su negocio en funcionamiento y lograr que siga siendo rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios, pues sueña con verlos graduados como profesionales y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 52, is married and has five children.  Throughout his productive life he has worked as a caretaker at different residences.  However, in order to take advantage of an opportunity to become independent, he decided to retire from his employment.  With his severance pay and some savings he bought a grocery story that was his father’s.  His father, being elderly, decided to return to his native town to spend the last years of his life.

He works every day of the week from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  He does this to take maximum advantage of the advantages he has of being very well located.  His neighbors generally consume his products daily.  The other advantage is the time he has in the market because it has been his property for 19 years.

The client is a charismatic and vigorous man who is dedicated to his family and his work.  He is always looking for new alternatives that will allow him to get ahead.  That is why he is motivated to request a loan.  With the loan he intends to fix the motor of a cooler and to buy stock wholesale (snacks, dairy products, meats, eggs, grains, pastas, and soft drinks, among others).  This will allow him to improve the condition of his assets, and he will be able to offer a greater variety of products.  He will also satisfy his customers’ needs and preferences.  As a result his sales will increase as well as the income he gets from his work.

Pedro wishes to continue working arduously in order to keep his business functioning and to manage to continue being profitable and long-lasting throughout time.  He wishes to continue supporting his children’s education.  He dreams of seeing them graduate as professionals.  He also dreams of enjoying a better quality of life and well-being in the company of his loved ones.

loans.use: to fix the motor of a cooler and to buy stock wholesale (snacks, dairy products, meats, eggs, grains, pastas, and soft drinks, among others).

loans.name: Dunia

texts.en:
Dunia was born in 1988. She is single and lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Zarqa with her 3 sisters and her parents. Dunia has been selling Russian golden accessories for 2 years. She started her project by selling a small quantity of them to her neighbors and friends. 

Now she wants to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of Russian golden accessories to raise her sales and income in order to start helping her parents financially. She also wants to add variety to her products by offering cosmetic items as well. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of Russian golden accessories and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 43-year-old, married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is running a business in which he provides plastic bottles to the firms for recycling, and crushing for reshaping. He buys plastic bottles that contained Pepsi, Coke, Mirinda, and other beverages and sells them to the firms for crushing or recycling. Through this business he makes enough income to contribute to his family's livelihood.
She has five children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well.  She is in her third loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. 
Currently she has requested a loan to buy more bottles in different sizes to increase the sales of her husband. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business.

loans.use: To buy plastic bottles to sell for crushing and recycling.

loans.name: Al-Dhakra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Dhakra and consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are hardworking women. They have applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. Dhakra is the leader of this group, a single woman who tries her best to improve her life. She owns a small house that was started by her buying a small piece of land. This took great effort on her part. Now, she would like to expand her house. 

She has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials like wood to complete the ceiling of her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood to complete the ceiling of her house.

loans.name: Indell 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   INDELL  4 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Bandiagara est une localité constituée à 90%  de falaise où les femmes ont comme activité principale la culture d’oignon et de sa transformation en échalote et sous produits. Les femmes transportent de la terre arable sur les hauteurs afin de confectionner leurs planches destinées à leurs pratiques agricoles. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec   Djènèba Kandia   assise en deuxième  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 23.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (scolarisation des enfants, santé et nourriture), achat de petits ruminants et vollailes  et investir le reste dans les activités.

The women transport arable earth uphill to make planting beds for their farm work.

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Hawa, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Bandiagara.

She plans on making a profit of 25,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting effort. This profit will allow her to help out her husband in covering family expenses (the children's schooling costs, healthcare, and food), to purchase small ruminants and poultry, and to reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon is the married mother of two children, living in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province.  

She does rice-planting while her husband is a palm juice maker. With 30 years' experience in this business, she is able to earn up to USD 3 per day and keep USD 1.5 each day as savings.

Samon has joined VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is now applying for a loan to pay her son’s university tuition. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden for her family.  Thereby she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay her son’s university tuition

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Vardishagh

texts.en:
Vardishagh is a farmer from the Masis village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband works in the private sector with a very low salary that does not cover the expenses of the family. For more than 15 years the family has been extensively engaged in agribusiness. 

With the help of her family members, Vardishagh is engaged in livestock, including cows and hens, and in the cultivation of beans, tomatoes, eggplant, pepper, alfalfa and several fruits (peach, apricot, fig, apple, pear and walnut). Her sons help her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

As the family's needs are growing day by day, Vardishagh wants to increase the number of livestock to effectively meet her family's needs. A loan of USD 2,500 will be a great support, enabling her to purchase two steers and some forage for the livestock. 

As this is Vardishagh’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Vardishagh and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 42 years old and married to John, a 42-year-old man. Their marriage is blessed with three children, namely: Silvester, 16, 1st grade of a vocational high school; Paulina, 15, 3rd grade of a junior high school; and Maria, 6, early childhood education.

Ester has been running a kiosk business since 2008. She sells soap, detergents, snacks, soft drinks, cakes, instant noodles, gasoline, mobile phone credit cards, and sometimes Nasi Kuning (a package of yellow rice with omelet, noodles, and chili), too. 

In order to increase the income of her business she has applied an individual loan from TLM in amount of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on more stocks, such as snacks, soft drinks, instant noodles, cigarettes, and mobile phone credit cards, and on electrical installation for her kiosk.  

She hopes that the business will run well so it will enable her to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to buy stocks such as snacks, soft drink, instant noodles, cigarette, and mobile phone credit cards and pay for electrical installation

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan is a 57-year-old married man and he has 3 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He learned to operate a small business from his parents. Through a lot of sacrifice, he has become one of the leaders in agriculture for the area in which he lives. He continued working in the same business after he was married. With the income from the business, he was able to raise cattle successfully. Aslan also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.

His monthly income is about 120 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income for his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday meals. Aslan applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase 2 cattle, one milking cow and fodder. This will be his 1st loan. He hopes that Kiva will help him.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cattle, one milking cow and fodder.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an egg vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and also earns an income from running a general store. Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Arlene is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 61 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, laundry soap, cream, cereals, etc. 

She has borrowed and paid off 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from retailing electronic mobile load. Alfreda wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, laundry soap, cream, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is 19 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her brother and her parents. Anwar is studying nutrition technology and is in her second year of a university program. 

Anwar is requesting a loan to pay her upcoming semester fees. She is planning to continue her studies and work in her field after graduation to start helping her family as they are currently facing a financial crisis.

loans.use: to pay upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa was born in 1979. She is married and a mother of 3. Her husband works in agriculture. As her husband’s siblings are young and their parents passed away, Sanaa is also responsible for them, and is considering them as her own children. 

She has been selling blankets and clothes for a year. She started her project selling a small quantity of them, and she found it profitable and a good support for her family. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes and blankets to raise her productivity and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Sanaa applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of blankets and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ebrahim Group

texts.en:
Ebrahim Group consists of three women and a man, all of whom live in Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 120,000 YER to pay for carpentry. 

Mariam, who is 35 years old and lives with her family in Taiz, is the leader of the group. She has a small house and has been accumulating money for a few years in order to build two extra rooms. To complete construction, she has requested a loan of 30,000 YER to buy additional building materials.

Mariam hopes to open a savings account for her family members after finishing house construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 19 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his five siblings and his parents. Ahmad is studying for a diploma in Mechanical Engineering, first year.  He also works as a mechanic. He is planning to continue his studies until he gets his Bachelor Degree to be able to find a better job after graduation, and to start earning a better income to help his family financially. Mohammad doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.en:
Tazagul is 42 years old and married with two children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Agdash IDP Settlement.  She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than eight years. She is very hardworking and passionate about her work. She considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers, and to plant fruit trees with her husband. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make a profit in order to support her family. Her monthly income from this business is about 130 AZN.

In order to improve the living conditions of her family, Tezegul plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes that in the near future her sons will help her to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, she wants the business to continue and prosper. She has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 700 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 32 years old and the father of two children.  He has been working as a plumber since he was 19 years old. Ahmad is a multi-tasking person who works hard to manage several businesses at a time to make sure that he is capable of covering his family's needs.

In addition to his work as a plumber, Ahmad started a new business in March 2013 that has to do with entertaining people, to increase his family's income. He opened a entertainment shop where he provides people with services such as Play Station, billiards, and Babyfoot.

Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start a lingerie-selling business.  He plans to ask his wife to run it at home, in a way that she'll fill free time with something productive and at the same time take care of her family.

loans.use: To  start a new business selling lingerie

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 36 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Francoise runs a food market where she sells various retail items. 

Francoise is requesting a loan to buy more liters of cooking oil and maize flour to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa es una señora de 53 años de edad, se dedica a la preparación envasado y venta al por menor de papas fritas las cuales son entregadas a vendedoras de mercados populares de la ciudad donde vive;  la señora Felipa está casada, el esposo ya es de avanzada edad el cual recibe un ingreso por jubilación pero no le alcanza dicho ingreso por los elevados costos de los medicamentos que él toma, no tiene hijos dependientes de ellos, dado que ya todos están casados o en otro departamento y se olvidaron de ellos, la señora Felipa  es una señora con ganas de superación y con mucho amor hacia su esposo esto es demostrado por el gran sacrificio que hace para poder comprar los medicamentos, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar más insumos y hace poder generar más ingresos para el bien de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Felipa is a 53-year-old-woman. She makes her living packaging and retailing french fries which are sold to vendors in popular markets in the city where she lives. Felipa is married, her husband is already advanced in age so he receives retirement income, but such income is not enough for the high cost of medications he takes. She does not have children who are dependent on them, given that they are all already married or in another apartment and they forgot about their parents.

Felipa is a woman with motivation to get ahead and with much love towards her husband. This is demonstrated by the great sacrifice that she makes to be able to buy the medicine. The purpose of the current loan is to be able to buy more supplies and to be able able to generate more income for the good of she and her husband.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to make french fries.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est un homme de 37 ans marié, père de 4 enfants dont l'age varien entre 4 et 13 ans. Après sa formation, il ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis 3 ans déjà. il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques,mèches et petit matériel dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de ses enfants, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en: Daniel is a 37-year-old man who is a married father of four children, from 4 to 13 years old. After finishing his training, he opened a hair salon, which he has been running for three years already. He often has a problem with a lack of cosmetic products, hair extensions, and sundry supplies in his salon, since he purchases his products retail. With a goal of satisfying his customers and making a bigger profit, he is requesting a loan to be able to purchase his supplies in large quantities enabling him to achieve his objectives. The profits earned from this loan will  help him to meet his needs and those of his children, as well as to save money to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to increase his stock of hair extensions, weaves, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Adila Group

texts.en:
Mayla is 33 and married with two children. She has a house and has started to build a room for herself and her husband. She is a member of the loan group, Adila, which consists of three ladies and a man who all live in Taiz, Yemen.

Mayla is requesting a loan to remodel her house and will use her portion of the loan to buy building materials such as cement and lumber. She is grateful for her loan and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cement and lumber

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
This is Abner. He previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit, and also to buy some equipment for the repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. Abner hopes to have another unit of tricycle and dreams that his children will finish their studies.

He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He attends the weekly fellowship* meetings that allow him to know more of God’s word. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar).

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 22 years old and has no children. Mouhammad has a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a house such as snacks, drinks, dairy products, and detergent. He has been a grocer since 2009 and has gained much experience in his field. Mouhammad is very well known in the surrounding areas and has an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan to pay the annual rent on his grocery store and buy more goods to sell. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his grocery store and buy more good to sell

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 23-year-old married youth client. He is from Iraq, has a single child and is the sole provider for his family. He is a barber and owns a barber shop. He has been in this field since 2008 and has gained much experience in this field through years of practice. He now has a hired employee and is becoming well-known in the surrounding area and has gained an excellent reputation.

Malek is applying for a youth loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to renovate his barber shop in order to attract more customers, improve the quality of his services and thus increase his profits.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler, corn, and a refrigerator, so that he can keep the ingredients for the pupusas, cakes, and other perishable products.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from the Armash village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, her three-year-old daughter, her parents-in-law and her brother-in-law. Anna's husband and brother-in-law work in the private sector. The family is engaged in the cultivation of tomatoes and several fruits (peach, apricot and apple). They sell the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is an important source of income for the family. 

To be able to continue their agribusiness in a sustainable way, there is a need to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will assist Anna in reaching her goal, enabling her to purchase fertilizers, tomato seeds, fuel for the agricultural machinery, and to pay for harvesting services. Anna and her big family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their good will and support in helping them collect the needed loan and sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, tomato seeds, fuel for the agricultural machinery, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en: Ameeneh is 21 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with her 6 siblings and her parents. One of her sisters is working at a governmental entity. Ameeneh is studying in her 2nd year for a Bachelor of Teaching degree. She is planning to continue her study to work in her field after graduation to start helping her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Otilda

texts.en: Otilda is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as slippers, noodles, cigarettes, eggs, books, pencils, salt, water and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, noodles, cigarettes, eggs, books, pencils, salt, water and biscuits.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of selling used clothing and curtains in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing and curtains to sell. Apolinaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: José es un señor de 49 años de edad, originario de Teustepe, casado y padre ejemplar de 9 hijos. Es de oficio Agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de Maíz, frijol y trigo. Inicio en este negocio hace 25 años con capital propio, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener a sus hijos, los cuales lo apoyan en este duro y pesado trabajo. Su meta próxima es darle mantenimiento a su terreno y cosechas. Solicita el préstamo para comprar: abonos y  semillas para cultivar, con el fin de aumentar su producción y tener una mejor calidad de productos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara aumentar sus ingresos y lograr un mantenimiento constante a sus cultivos. Su plan futuro es sembrar aún más semillas y ofrecer maíz, frijoles, trigo de calidad.
texts.en:
José is a 49 year-old man from Teustepe.  He is married and an exemplary father to 9 children.  He is a farmer, working in the cultivation of corn, beans, and wheat.  He began this work 25 years ago using his own capital.  With great effort he has managed to provide for his children, who help him in this heavy and difficult work.  

His next objective is to do maintenance on his land and his crops.  He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant, with the goal of increasing his production and having a higher quality product.  He thinks that the loan will help him to increase his income and manage a constant level of maintenance for his crops.  His future plan is to sew even more seeds and offer quality corn, beans, and wheat.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and seeds to grow

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Sreypich is 19 years old and a single woman living with her parents in Kandal province. She graduated from high school in 2011 and she continued studying at a college in Phnom Penh. She is a second-year student, majoring in English literacy. She has a passion for her major because she is aware that this major is suitable for her personality. Her education was subsidized by her parents. Her mother is a Krama (a sturdy traditional Cambodian garment weaver) and her father is a farmer.

Due to the family’s financial constraints, Sreypich decided to acquire a loan from HKL, a reliable MFI that provides a suitable loan term and interest charge. She will use 430 US dollars of the loan to pay the third year education fees of her program. She will use the other portion of the loan to buy materials needed to support her course. 

Sreypich is committed to studying hard with the loan funded, because she realizes that an education will give her the opportunity to get a high-paying job that will allow her to support her parents when they are getting older. She is pictured with her mother, who will be responsible for making principal repayments on the loan. Sreypich appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to programs like Kiva via its partner, HKL, which have supported education for her individually as well as for other students.

loans.use: to pay the third-year education fees of her program and buy materials needed to support her course.

loans.name: Sobeida  De Rocio

texts.es: Sobeida es una señora muy trabajadora de 45 años,  vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, ciudad de Ecuador, zona cálida húmeda, ciudad muy comercial por ser unión de la sierra y de la costa. Zona donde también se producen el plátano y cacao, sector muy productivo por su clima. Sobeida, es madre soltera, desde joven tuvo que ver la manera de salir adelante sola con su hijo. Comenzó vendiendo confitería ambulante para darle la educación, y aunque fue muy duro estar expuesta al peligro de las calles, ella fue ahorrando y poco a poco se pudo poner su tienda, ahora ya tiene 12 años en el negocio al cual le dedica todo el día. Con los ingresos hizo su casita, donde vive actualmente sola ya que su hijo es mayor de edad y ya tiene su familia. Conoció a Fundación Alternativa por muy buenas referencias de clientes que han sido beneficiados, ahora le han dado la oportunidad de salir adelante con un crédito el mismo que lo invertirá en arroz, aceite, azúcar y demás víveres, que incrementen el surtido de su tienda y por lo tanto sus ganancias; también con parte del dinero va a mejorar su casita ya que le faltan varios arreglos. Se siente muy agradecida con Fundación y Kiva  porque es el primer crédito que ha recibido en su vida. Con esta ayuda mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sobeida is a very hardworking, 45-year-old woman living in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a city in Ecuador with a hot, humid climate.  It’s a very commercial city because it’s a crossroads between the coast and the mountains.  It’s also a banana and cocoa bean producing zone that’s very productive thanks to its climate.

Sobeida’s a single mother.  Since she was young she had to find a way to raise her son alone.  She started out as a street vendor selling sweets in order to provide him with an education and although it was very hard being exposed to danger in the streets, she was able to save gradually until she was able to open her store.  She now has 12 years’ experience in the business she spends the entire day in.  She used her income to build her little house where she currently lives alone for her son is an adult now with a family of his own.  

She heard about Fundación Alternativa by means of very good references from clients that have benefited from it and now she’s had the opportunity of getting ahead with a loan that she’ll use to buy rice, oil, sugar and other food items to increase stock in her store and as a result increase her profits too.  She will also use part of the money to make some home repairs since her house is lacking a few improvements.  

She’s very grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva because this is the first loan she’s gotten her entire life.  It will help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improve her house.

loans.name: Eva Sandrit

texts.es: Eva es una joven campesina de 23 años de edad, nacida en el seno de una familia humilde que siempre se dedicó a las actividades del campo y, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, hoy en día ella se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, actividad con la que genera ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para brindar sustento a sus dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 1 años de edad. Su espíritu de superación, la tenacidad y la fortaleza con la que se levanta día a día, la impulsan para buscar nuevas opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar lechones y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para continuar solventando algunas necesidades familiares y, seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, que se ha convertido en la principal fuente de recursos económicos para la familia. Eva desea seguir luchando con empeño, dedicación y esfuerzo, para llegar a cumplir el sueño de adquirir más cerdos y tener una producción escalonada, que le garantice la entrada de utilidades constantemente y pueda brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Eva, 23, is a young farmer who was born into a humble family that’s always worked in the fields.  Thanks to her parents’ teaching she raises and sells pigs now, an activity that generates income she can use to help her husband cover household expenses and support her two children who are 8 and 1 years old.

Her spirit of self-improvement, tenacity and strength she awakens with every day push her to seek new options that will lead to success.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed concentrate to feed them to increase production and meet demand that increases in the upcoming Christmas season.  The result will be higher income to continue meeting family needs and reinvesting in her business that’s become the family’s main source of income.

Eva would like to continue striving with effort, dedication and determination to reach her dream of owning more pigs and to stagger production so that profits will be produced continuously so she can provide her children with better education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru: Абдучаббор холостой молодой человек в возрасте 22 лет. Он из Истаравшана. Абдучаббор около 5 лет работает водителем маршрутного такси. Он работает на маршруте город Истаравшан - город Худжанд. Выгоду, которую он получает от своей работы уходит на семью и ремонт автомобиля. Он живет с младшей сестрой и мамой. Несколько лет назад он потерял отца. Поэтому он сам поднимает свою семью. С помощью своей машины он зарабатывает. Из-за того что машина является старой, она нуждается в ремонте все чаще. Абдучаббор хочет купить новую машину, но денег на покупку ему не хватает. Он просит кредит, чтобы приобрести машину и продолжить свою работу на новом автомобиле.
texts.en: Abdujabbor is a young single 22 year old man. He is from Istaravshan. Abdujabbor has been working his taxi route for about five years. He works along the route from the city of Istarvshan to the city of Khujand. The returns he makes will go towards his family and automobile repairs. He lives with his younger sister and mother. Not long ago, he lost his father. Because of this he raises his family. With the help of his car he can earn income. Due to the fact that his car is old, it requires repairs more often. Abdujabbor wants to buy a new car, but he doesn't have enough money. He is asking for a loan to buy a car and continue his work with his new automobile.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz, a sus 46 años de edad, se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos desde que era joven, la actividad la aprendió de su familia, quien toda la vida se dedicó a las labores del campo. Su negocio inició con una cerda que estaba embarazada y, luego de tener sus crías, ella las alimentó durante un tiempo y luego vendió los lechones a vecinos del sector, fue así como poco a poco fue adquiriendo su capital de trabajo y ha logrado aportar a la economía de su familia, conformada por sus 3 hijos y su pareja sentimental. La cliente es una mujer pujante y dedicada a su labor, características por las que ha sido reconocida en la zona donde reside. Se motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará más lechones para cría y el concentrado para alimentar los animales; esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda creciente de la temporada de fin de año, en la que el consumo de este tipo de carne se incrementa notablemente, mejorando el margen de ganancia que recibe por cada venta. De esta forma, Luz desea continuar con su labor, aumentar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo más lechones y hacer de su actividad un negocio rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, que le permita tener la capacidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y disfrutar al lado de su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 46, has been raising and selling pigs since she was young, an activity she learned from her parents who have worked in the fields their entire lives.  Her business started with one pregnant sow and after the piglets were born Luz fed them for a time and then sold them to nearby neighbors.  This was how she gradually acquired working capital and contribute to family economy.  Her family consists of her three children and her spouse.

She’s a very driven woman who is dedicated to her work which has made her very well-known in the community she lives in.  She’s motivated to request the loan’s support to buy more piglets to raise and feed concentrate to feed them.  This will make it possible for her to continue with her work and increase production to meet the expected increased demand at the end of the year season when pork consumption rises considerably.

This will improve her profit margin on each sale and Luz will be able to continue with her work purchasing more piglets and increasing her working capital to make her business still more profitable so she can enjoy better quality of life alongside her husband.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Tanriverdi

texts.en:
Tanriverdi is 60 years old. He is a father of four children. He is a grandfather, too. 

He is a popular merchant in his city because he has been selling household goods for 35 years. He said that he started this business with money that he had earned from previous jobs. Month by month, he is growing his business with this hard-earned money. This activity generates sufficient income and there is strong demand for his goods since he has a lot of customers every day. 

In order to satisfy customer demand and expand his business, Tanriverdi needs a loan of AZN 1,500. This will let him continue with his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying new household goods.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Martha, es madre de dos hijos de 3 y 13 años de edad y cabeza de hogar desde el día que su esposo la abandonó. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa de apuestas como vendedora y, para complementar los ingresos, alterna su empleo con la venta de mercancía por catálogo, actividad que realiza de manera independiente y empírica.
